Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique hotel in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Savannah W
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything 15 minutes to most sights. Beautifully appointed Hotel with extremely helpful staff. Will definitely return, have stayed the last 2 times I have been in Rome and fell in love with the hotel, rooms, and above all staff. Excellent nearby restaurants, cafes and bars. All my requests have been met with a smile and courteous response! Many thanks to Bernardo at reception and Davide and Issam at the bar, great service always.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bmac169
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in the centre of Rome with easy access to all tourist attractions this is the hotel. Maximum walk of 15 minutes to Vatican. Great Hotel with extremely helpful staff. Would definately stay here again. Remember there is a set taxi fare from airport to central Rome of €40. Don't be fooled by limo (shared taxi) drivers in arrivals. There is a set fair with white taxi to central rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: SSyssy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriano is one of the best hotel in Rome for location and comfort. Very central situeted, excelent for those who prefer visit the eternal city walking. Excelent also are the restaurants neraby, nice caffee for happy hour or just a quick espresso!! Very good breakfast with a good cappuccino - on request to the lovely waitress - thanks to Carl and Sylvie for their smile. A very good experience to repeat one day...

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service? What is that?”
Reviews.Author: KarenGrMtnGirl
Reviews.Content: Posh looking tiny room at first look. Requested plug adapter 3 times and was told, "not available" so I walked down the street and bought one. Used usb plug until then and when turned the screen a bit to add cable, was greeted with Santa Claus beard-like dust on back of screen. The attitude toward guests is "give me your money and go away" much different than other Italian experiences. (Stayed is a much cheaper hotel in Florence--much larger room, not posh decorating--Hotel Casci--with a host of adapters, terrifically friendly, and spotlessly clean.) Breakfast at Adriano was good but same type of less than friendly attitude--when a lady accidentily ran into me and spilled my juice, we cleaned it up as the waitresses mysteriously vanished. Having worked in hospitality, the coldness was off-putting and the helpfulness totally lacking. Won't stay again even for the cool looking mini-room.

Reviews.Title: “Not allowed access to roof terrace - only for use by the management of hotel.”
Reviews.Author: steve h
Reviews.Content: Room good - only a small issue the bath plug does not release as it should. Breakfast room very nice & relaxing - only a small issue lion statue hidden low down behind a table would be good to see in a more prominent position. Only real weakness about the breakfast was a lack of good quality Orange juice. Would also suggest a card on each table letting guests know that a coffee/ Capuciona can be requested as many guests will have missed out on the beautifull fresh drink. Many open spaces with a variety of art - some good, some not so good but a wonderfull relaxing setting. 15 Euros for a return trip on a coach from Fiumincino airport to and from Paizza Cavour - 20 to 30 minute walk to hotel. Only 1 computer to access the internet in a room near reception and this was not there one morning. Improvement and at a small cost would be to have 2 computers in this room. All in all though a very good hotel in a perfect location. Please remove all photos of roof terrace as I do not wish to see pictures of what is not available to guests.

Reviews.Title: “overall very good”
Reviews.Author: sniffer31
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights the beginning of March 2012. Had a triple room which seemed like a double room with some sort of very hard mattress stuck in the corner but OK. Room and bathroom were clean enough but had a problem with the floor always having huge dustballs all over the place, but the bathroom was clean and new. Even though we made reservations last August we did not get updated to A newer room. Breakfast was OK but was included with our room price so not much complaining on that part, but have had better at other hotels. Although living in the USA breakfast buffets tend to be huge. Liked the location seemed very convenient to lots of things, the staff was very nice and overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Robbie M
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything but just far enough away to be able to relax. Walked to everything really easily. Rome is fantastic and the Hotel helped make it extra special. Had a little misunderstanding about a bottle of champers that should have been in the room on arrival but didn't distract from our stay. Will definitely go back and will recommend to everyone I know. Room was lovely, kept very clean. I Agree with the other comments about the breakfast. If you are going to Rome (which everyone should) then stay at the Adriano.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Our Return!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Best location. Quaint, cozy and clean. Sylvia was a great help and most kind. Stayed 5nights w/terrace room. One note for the terrace, the chair and chaise are stylish but not comfy. Still, it worked for having some vino and chilling while getting fresh air. Left windows open at night for the fresh are and to hear the church bells. Little to no car noise at all. Simply wonderful. Thank you Sylvia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet Location but Central”
Reviews.Author: thetunnery
Reviews.Content: This was a good find. It's easy to walk to most of the sites from here yet it is tucked up a quiet road. Even though our room was at the front, there was no traffic noise. The staff were very friendly. The bedroom was not huge but perfectly adequate for two adults. The bathroom was a good size although you had to get into a slightly awkward position to shower. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: corbovit
Reviews.Content: Very well priced... Great 4 day stay in the middle of European freeze... Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Avtobus Posted by a Jaz Hotels and Resorts traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and worth the money. We paid app 400€ for 3 nights with breakfast in January during the holidays. Location is superb. You have all important monuments in walking distance. You can walk to Spanish steps thru most famous designer shopping street, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Coloseum and Vatican city. Longest walk is 20 min. We stayed in apartment next to hotel, so called Domus. Its old building in which one big apartment was renovated with 5 rooms. + You have a kitchen in apartment with 5 rooms - From street you have to unlock 4 doors to your room, two stairs and small lift ( 2 person max) Despite its called Exclusive room its quite small, newly renovated and nice but SMALL. Its not 26m2 as advertised on Booking.com Internet is available and free in whole hotel including Domus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Nasty Smell”
Reviews.Author: christaylor95
Reviews.Content: First of all the good points: The hotel is in a perfect location to walk to pretty much all the main sights that Rome has to offer. The staff were very friendly and possibly the world's best pizzeria, Pizzeria da Pasquale, is just around the corner. There is also decent free wi-fi. Now the bad points: We stayed in one of the newly renovated deluxe rooms, 322. The room was a bit on the small side but smelt terribly, a combination of mildew and sewage. I've backpacked around Asia and have a strong stomach but the smell actually woke me up one night as it was so strong. Another thing is that if you want to watch tv and don't speak Italian you'll have to pay extra to get additional channels in English and movies etc. My girlfriend also said that the hairdryer was useless and it took her over an hour to dry her hair (apparently this is very important for you ladies!) Another bad point is the buffet breakfast, if you can opt not to pay for this I wouldn't bother. Rock hard bread, cold eggs etc and there didn't appear to be any real system as to what you should be doing. The location really is the draw card for this hotel, otherwise it is quite average. It didn't take away our enjoyment of the city, which we loved, but for the price (certainly not cheap) I would look for something else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location only”
Reviews.Author: GissBergen
Reviews.Content: * I booked a so called Double Room Exclusiv.Domus ADriani, mostly for the price/location and because the official pics of the hotels didnt look bad at all. But this Domus Adriani, is another building, quite close to the main hotel but something TOTALLY different than living in a hotel. The fasade of the building is being renovated what makes the building extra ugly, inside no cleaning was done any day, people smoked and threw the ends on the common stairs. The lift was a joke of so small, if you are a big american fellow, forget it, you may have to walk up 4 floors. Another thing is if one forgets the inner door of the lift open in another floor, it would stop working ie, you could press the button but it never arrived. . Not to mention the key holder with 5 keys we had to carry around and remember which key to use for which door. * General sleeping conditions were low in the room 508, small room and loud machine noise coming from something in the terrace. * We asked for another room in the main building and they arranged a much bigger one next morning, but since we were staying for 2 more nights and had unpacked we didnt want to move, especially after checking out the new room and feeling the strong smell of cigarette inside. * The lobby was modern/cosy/design , in a limit of being overcrowded by decorative objects. * The staff = italian, not over kind, but not the opposite and they did speak good enough english. * Finally, the hotel was close to absolutely everything, especially if you dont mind walking a couple of meters, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, even Vatikan. Would I stay there again ?? Yes, if I didnt have any other better option, but would NEVER book in Domus ADriani again. Breakfast, they have fruits, scrambled eggs, croissants, cappucino...yogurt... 3 types of bread... it was good enough to me. A last comment especially to norwegian famillies travelling in a big group. It might be good for you to stay at Domus ADriani, since you can all share a long terrace outside to enjoy a drink together at night when the kids have gone to bed. You also share a small kitchen and can make coffee, tea and maybe seat together if you dont fancy outside.But again, your kids might like to walk up stairs or wait to each small group to arrive up with the small lift and send it back again. GW

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Enxhi V
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriano was a great find in Rome. I stayed at the hotel the last 3 days and i enjoyed each of them. Good rooms, with big, clean bathrooms. Loved and really enjoyed the lobby area. it has different cozy areas, but we enjoyed the one with the computer, from which we could connect freely to the internet every time we liked the breakfast was good, with variety of choices and the recepsionist friendly and always happy to help and the best Pro. THE LOCATION which could not be better walking distance to every major attraction in rome. it took u 15 minutes to the vatican, 20 to the colosseum (by foot) and via del corso just 5 minutes away from which you can easily reach everything else near the hotel you can also find some pleasent hotels, and giolittii, to taste whats called the best ice cream in rome (and really was)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: saletepezzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has nothing special but its location couldn´t be better. It´s within walking distance to the most famous sites in Rome. Professional service. We didn´t use the parking but were offered to. Breakfast was very good, too. We stayed there in the beginning and the end of the trip and in the second time we got a surprising upgrade concerning the rooms which pleased us a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: touringj
Reviews.Content: As an experienced tour leader I have researched and stayed in many hotels in Rome and the Hotel Adriano is an exceptional find. It is now the only hotel I will use in this city. On a purely practical level its position close to the city centre within walking distance of many significant monuments is perfect. More important than this, however, is the outstanding service, the beautifully appointed and spotless rooms, the attention to detail and the elegant reception and bar area that provide both a sense of welcome and privacy for relaxation. The staff in all areas of the hotel are outstanding in their friendliness, their efficiency and their readiness to assist. Your hosts at this hotel make their clients feel truly at home.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adriano”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton338
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriano certainly has a very convenient location, being just a short walk from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Other main sites are also walkable including the Vatican, Spanish Steps and even the Coliseum - although we did order a taxi for the return back to the hotel. The location of the hotel is in an atmospheric area of narrow streets, so a detailed street map is a good idea until you familiarise yourself with local landmarks. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby, so eating out isn’t a problem. The cobbled roads can be uneven so flat shoes with good grips are recommended for wetter weather. The hotel rooms are clean, reasonably spacious and the bed was comfortable, although I don’t see any advantage to guests from the open style of wardrobe where clothes are on display. The heavy doubled glazed windows keep out the noise from the streets and although I am a light sleeper the external noise didn’t disturb me. The rooms did get very warm in the night, even though it was early November and I had to adjust the settings on the air con control with only limited effect –it might be that the air con is turned down when the summer finishes. There is free internet access via a computer on the ground floor which was useful for confirming the seat locations on the return flight. The breakfast was OK and seemed to cover most guests’ wants with cereals, muffins, yoghurts, croissants and so on. The breakfast room could get a bit crowded at popular times and it’s a pity cappuccino couldn’t be more freely available. Although we didn’t ask the staff for directions or restaurant recommendations the front desk and bar staff were friendly and helpful. I booked an airport pickup and drop off myself via the internet and although there was no problem with the service I received the hotel can arrange this at a slightly cheaper rate – email them a few days before you arrive. A tip for visiting St Peters and the Vatican Museum (for the Sistine chapel) - beware of tour guides who offer a service including ‘jumping the queues’. For the Vatican museum any advantage from not having to queue for tickets is lost by having to walk to the tour company’s office to pay and then hanging around waiting for other members of the group to join. In addition the Vatican museum is so huge you are better taking your time and stopping for a break in the cafeteria half way round rather than being forced to follow the tour guides itinerary. The tour guides also have no official status that I could see with St Peters and you will end up queuing like everyone else, so save your money. Finally check before you start to queue for St Peters as sometimes access is restricted for special services as we found out after waiting in line for nearly 1 hour!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Caryaovata
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in perhaps one of the newer rooms. It was spacious (for Rome) and very quiet. Wifi was free in the room. Used the lobby computer to book Vatican tickets in advance, send the confirmation to the front desk, and they printed our receipt for us. As we are independent travelers we did not use the front desk for much, but they were kind enough when approached.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: BHoboken
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this hotel but the service I received put quite the wrench in my time there. The only redeeming quality was it being in a good location to the attractions and the buffet breakfast (minus the eggs - they had enough salt in them for 2 days worth of sodium). One of my first issues if they did a whole renovation why were the windows not replaced. I heard every car, motorcycle, conversation, music that was outside. It was impossible to sleep because of the noise. I also did not feel safe when they left the hallways windows wide-open and at night when walking through the alley area. When I arrived the morning man took care of me. I asked the morning woman for help getting to places and everything was either 1 minute, 5 minutes, or 20 minutes. Though I came to learn to add or subtract 10 minutes because her walking times were way off. Pantheon was 5 minutes and Trevi Fountain was 20 minutes. In reality the Pantheon is and Trevi Fountain are across the street from each other. The morning man however, was disrespectful and rude. When I tried to ask a question as to where something was he put up his hand, said very rudely to ask her, and wiped his hand in the air as to shoo me away. The next morning when I asked for him to call a taxi he threw his hands up in the air, said impossible, and ignored me. When I then asked for another way to get to the train station he said very rudely again "I don't know". Never mind that I then reminded him, after I remembered, the Spagna Metro was 10 minutes away. This is a hotel I would not stay at again. For the price they charge I would have expected, and should have received, much better service and treatment. I also would not recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Robert16
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It had a certain style; it felt “authentic” without giving the impression it was trying to. Part of an old building, fairly recently renovated, but preserving some original features. Unpretentious on the outside, labyrinthine inside, woven into the fabric of its area. I dare say tourists coming to Rome to experience Vespas, gelateria, and sultry Italian evenings will love this place. Its age and authentic feel didn’t mean it lacked modern amenities though; nice breakfast, air-con, modern bathroom, nice bed – all present. My bathroom had an odd feature though. Whoever installed the shower screen on my bath apparently had no idea how they work. He installed it on the outside of the bath tub. This meant that every drop of water from the shower that hit the screen ended up, not back in the bath, but on the floor. At the end of my showers, the bathroom floor was somewhere between seriously damp and downright flooded. And the area the hotel is in! Just great. Location is a big plus point of this hotel. Some of Rome’s major sites are but a short stroll away, and everything Rome has to offer is readily accessible. But that’s only half the story. The hotel’s immediate vicinity is a maze of narrow, cobbled streets, small squares, little cafés and bars, gelateria and pizzeria. Charming. There’s a nice little pizza shop close to the hotel, frequented by locals (always a good sign) that’ll do you several chunks of nice pizza on a tray, plus a drink, for five Euros. Recommended. Don’t confuse it with the absurdly expensive restaurant on the opposite side of the square. The hotel’s area felt safe too – it seemed to be constantly full of police, day and night, and not mere city police, but Carabinieri, in large numbers. It can be hard to find the hotel though; returning from my first day, it took me quite a while and an Android smartphone with GPS and Google Maps to get back. Seriously – I recommend a GPS device, or getting detailed maps of the immediate area (full city tourist maps don’t always show the detail of these narrow streets) and a compass. Really – a compass; lost near my hotel, I could sometimes work out which street I was on, but not always which direction I was facing. Equipped with a compass, I’d have got back to my hotel a lot faster. Still, getting lost in this area was quite a pleasure in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Room without a view”
Reviews.Author: 1moretimetraveller
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Hotel Adriano. I am a fan of more modern hotels and hotel Adriano suited me well. We stayed in a superior room which was more than adequate for the time spent in the room. The hotel is so well situated in the historical centre that you are a stones throw away from lovely restaurants, shops, etc. Two negative points for us was the room had absolutely no view! The breakfast was also not great. that aside, staff were helpful and we enjoyed a very pleasant stay at Hotel Adriano.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Martin W
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, a short walk from Piazza Navona. The rooms where nice and clean (had a deluxe room) and the service was good, very helpful with recommandations and reservations. The breakfast was a bit dissapointing. I don't expect much from breakfast in Italy, but powder based scrambled eggs and "fake" orange juice is a bit below standard.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: very nice, modern hotel. The room we had was clean, new, modern, but there was no standard cupboard with doors. Just on the wall something to hang on stuff and some shelves. Our room had windows into one of a very small inner yard. Advantages: very quiet Drawback: absolutly no view, poor light. Breakfast is OK, very good italian cappucino and espresso, also american coffee, if you want. Nearest greater known super market (DeSpar) is in direction of Pantheon, in Via Giustiani, 10min walk. Tabbachis, Specialities Markets, banks with bancomat, good restaurants and some other little shops are very close. If you are interesting in Panini stickers (for example football/soccer world cup albums), the Italian headquarter is just some meters close to the hotel. All things considered, we can recommend this hotel anyhow. Perhaps.... the rate could be a little better.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: GIANNINI
Reviews.Content: If you want a perfect location to visit all the popular sights in Rome within walking distance then this is the hotel for you. Just a short walk to Piazza Navona, Pantheon and not far to Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. Very helpful and friendly staff always on hand . Breakfast was good, typically continental with a few extras. The room we had was your average sized hotel room, very clean and comfortable and looking out onto one of the quaint little streets.Overall a really lovely hotel in a beautiful city where we had a most memorable stay and would definitely return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle C
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a vacation in Rome. I spent 10 days at the Hotel Adriano, from September 18 to September 28th and I absolutely loved it. I was travelling alone so the proximity to just everything was quite appreciated (5 to 15 minutes from Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and other must-see sites). The hotel is lovely and the breakfast was so much better than I expected with a variety of breads, cereals, yogurts, croissants, eggs, juices, coffee... The staff was kind and helpful also. My room was perfect and I was never heard a noise (walking 5 to 8 hours a day will really knock you out at night). When I return to Rome I will definitely stay there again. I chose this hotel because of the fabulous comments I had read on Trip Advisor and I am so glad I did. Thank you Hotel Adriano for making my stay in Rome a pleasurable one!! Isabelle C.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Volares
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Italy and we stayed at the Adriano in Rome. We would recommend it highly. The location is perfect. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was excellent. The hotel is really very nice. The room itself was a bit small, but typical of Europe...the bathroom and shower were good, so no complaints about room or noise.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GellybeanRomford
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights 27th to 30th June. It is very central with all major sights and plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. The rooms are nice and clean and well looked after and the staff are approachable and helpful. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Our room was a bit noisy - we were on the 2nd floor overlooking the road and you could clearly hear the traffic noise and the clatter of a loose drain cover every time a car went over it. I'd definitely stay there again but would ask for a room on a higher floor or overlooking the central courtyard. Careful on the way out of the hotel too - it is right on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room in the new side”
Reviews.Author: Ourdream2
Reviews.Content: We paid more than 250 Euros/night for a Jacuzzi bedroom and we're really regretting it. Very old bedroom with mold in every corner. Bugs in bed and mosquitos once opening the windows. Strong bad smell once we opened the room, some fixing in the toilet were going on probably. We stayed mostly outside the hotel because of this strong smell. We found a large dirty and wet towel thrown in the tub! It was a shock! The reception and lobby with very nice decorations and design but beware of the rooms, they are totally different. Ask for a room in the new extension - walls with modern design and black color. Some of the receptionist staff were rude. We asked to have our luggage from the storage to check out and the receptionist told us to pick them from the storage!!! How about the other people luggage, why he didn't think about the security of these people luggage?! I went there and I found many luggage there and very difficult to get ours, so I asked the other receptionist and she called the hotel-boy to do so. The reception services must be improved otherwise it'll effect their reputation. The lift is very small. Breakfast was good. Wireless internet not working in our room and I postponed my flight check-in one day till I went to the lobby and I worked near the wireless machine and then it has worked! I stayed in 5 hotels in Italy in 10 days and I've never hate a hotel as much as this hotel because I paid much and I've got nothing!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel very central within walking distance to all the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: ally089
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in august the hotel is so central it is about 15 minutes walkk to the vatican the colosseum and most of the tourist attractions this hotel is not cheap but it is worth it as you dont have to spend much money on transport the reception staff were ok cant say that they were that helpful to me the bedroom was very clean and air conditioning nice comfortable bed and the bathroom was so spacious the room was cleaned every day and to the house keeping staff i would give them a 100% for their great work the breakfast was great with a variety of cereals juices different fruits cakes bread eggs and the staff were friendly i give them a 100%l also there is free internet in the hotel and there are lots of places to sit in the lounge area across the hotel there is a nice bar which serves food as well hope to return to rome and stay longer next time would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with really good service and pleasant public rooms...”
Reviews.Author: reginalampert
Reviews.Content: ...they even will rent you bicycles! The breakfast was good and plentiful, the room we had was a duplex Jr. Suite which had been recently renovated in an ultra-modern style. There were minor flaws, like the frosted glass partition between the rooms and the bathrooms don't quite mask what the person in the bathroom is up to, but since we were a family, we just asked each other not tho look! The people at the desk were helpful and knowledgeable and very friendly. The walk to the Pantheon is less than 5 minutes; to the Spanish Steps, less than 10 minutes, to the Piazza Navona, less than 5 minutes--and to Giolitti, one of the best Gelato places-(-not fancy like San Crispino, which also has a shop near the Pantheon) is also less than a 5 minute walk. If you want to get to a gift shop that carries Buccellati silver and other goodies at the best prices in Rome, go to Anticoli, which is located at 2 PM on a clock if you're standing at the entrance to the Pantheon and looking out. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel, our Jr. Suite was ample, the linens were delightful, if nobody is renting the large suite on the top floor, I believe that they allow you access to the rooftop terrace, which I'm sure is lovely. My son was pleased that they have Wi-Fi, and I was very happy to be on a relatively quiet street, and yet still be in the heart of Rome's historic center. One caveat--be very careful when exiting the hotel. The street in front of the hotel is very narrow, with no sidewalk, so it is possibly dangerous to you as a defenseless pedestrian.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dthompson39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend, everything is within walking distance - pantheon and Trevino fountain just 5 mins away! And free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: benzowner
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on Trip Advisor about the great location for this hotel and they proved to be true. The hotel is within fairly easy walking distance to all the main attractions in Rome. My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in late August. We had booked a Deluxe room based on the hotel website. When we saw the room we were disappointed that although it was good sized the room was not one that had been upgraded. When I asked to move to an upgraded room, the desk attendant said they had none available that night but could move us to a Superior room for the next two nights, which we agreed to. When we got moved, the room had been upgraded, but was much smaller than the original room. In restrospect we probably should have stayed in our original room. The breakfast was very good and the room where it was served was very nice. The rooms were kept clean but some of the bathroom fixtures, even in the upgraded rooms had some mold around the shower area. There was also an odour in our second room, that we could not quite figure out. There were some sented sticks in the bathroom which may have been the source or they might have been placed there to try to cover other odours. I'd consider staying at the Adriano if I return to Rome due to the excellent location but would want to check out the room before checking in to make sure I know what I was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FranCare
Reviews.Content: Friendly, great reception area with WiFi. Breakfast was good. Location great, and airconditioned room had all we needed. Would go back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location/Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben F
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Italy for 10 days for vacation. I found this hotel through endless searches for creature comforts like a/c and a king size bed. We booked a three night stay at the hotel over the internet. Just before our departure we got an email from the hotel offering to pick us up from the airport for 55 euro. This was very reasonable considering we would have to take the train for 15 euro each as well as a cab from the train station anyway. I would absolutely suggest this option. We arrived at the hotel at 9am after an overnight flight and were greeted by a gracious desk clerk. He helped us secure our bags while we walked around Rome and made some suggestions of things to do near the hotel as check-in time was not until 2pm. When we checked into our hotel we found the room to be just like the pictures. Completely updated amenities(flat screen t.v. etc), clean rooms, nice bathrooms and a king size bed. Many hotels actually push two twins together but this was an actual king mattress. We really didn't realize how lucky we were with the location of this hotel. It is ideally located right near the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and 15 minutes from the Vatican and the Colliseum(Opposite directions). The hotel common areas are very clean and have plenty of comfortable couch seating. In full disclosure I must mention the breakfast. There is a large selection of fruit, pastry, coffee, and hot eggs and ham. However the fruit wasn't ripe and the eggs and ham were a little dry. But it was free!! All in all I though the price was very reasonable and the location could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: beachroamerontario
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fabulous location. We had a newly renovated room with plenty of space for 3 of us. Staff were pleasant and available. We would definitely stay here again. Location, Location, Location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, Friendly staff who had great restaurant recommendations, superbly clean with comfy beds! Staff communicated very well in English, We will definitely stay again when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: chrisylou
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and spent four nights at Hotel Adriano. The location and the value were excellent! There are many restaurants and shops nearby. The night atmosphere was lively and we felt very safe. The location was perfect for walking to all the sights (5 min to Pantheon, 10 to Trevi fountain and Spanish steps, 15 to Roman Forum, and 20 to Colessuem and Vatican). We couldn’t have picked a better spot! The breakfast was included in our stay and was very good with hot and cold options. The room was clean and comfortable. Wi-Fi was free and worked great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband and I were extremely pleased with our choice and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie_399
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Adriano on my arrival to Rome. The driver sent by the hotel to pick me up at the airport was wonderful. He gave me a quick driving tour around the city before taking me to the hotel. The front desk was helpful. The hotel is very elegant. I had a double room in the new wing of the hotel. The rooms are contemporary and spacious for hotels in Rome. I especially like the bathroom layout with the separate shower. Breakfast at the hotel was good with an average selection. I do think the hotel might offer a few more selections. I selected this hotel after reading the other reviews on tripadvisor, but I'm frankly not sure why this hotel has not ranked even higher. The location was really good--near the Pantheon, the Piazza Navone and fantastic cafes. I would definitely stay here again upon returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel and Worth a Bit of a Splurge”
Reviews.Author: ericnyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel rates in Rome have really gotten out of hand, and it seems near-impossible to find charming places at a budget rate. So while I think that the rates for Hotel Adriano are overpriced, considering the marketplace, this is a good value for your money. As many have mentioned on this site, the location is really what you're paying for, and it's a doozy. One of the greatest joys of visiting Rome is walking through the historic district at night, and this hotel posits you in a perfect position for this...a 2-minute walk from the Pantheon, 8-minute walk from Piazza Navona, 13-minute walk to Spanish Steps, etc. You are also right around the corner from arguably the best gelato spot in Rome, Giolitti. The rooms aren't what I'd consider spacious, but they're not overly cramped. We paid for a modern-decor room with a small balcony, which was worth the upgrade. The staff was actually quite helpful with making dinner reservations and answering questions. There's a great little bar in the lobby, as well as a comfortable seating area for making the day's plans. I've stayed in several budget hotels in Rome over the years, and even they are no longer a bargain. So I'd make the $200/night-or-more splurge on the Hotel Adriano...you'll be staying in a quite nice hotel in the most ideal location possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: claire2767
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of our 2 week holiday in Italy in July. We booked a triple superior room with a terrace. The room itself was lovely- modern, new, clean with a great bathroom. The terrace was brilliant, shame it rained on our last day!! The hotel itself was really nice, we had no issues at all except that breakfast was a bit chaotic. On our first morning it was very busy and whilst we were up getting food people had sat at our table. It would be better if there is actually someone supervising things. The location of the hotel in the historical centre was great. Overall I would definitely stay here again. There seem to be some mixed reviews around the rooms, I would pay the extra to get a superior one. It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Harmer's stay at the hotelAdriano, Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Mikeha123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was best placed for our stay in Rome. The cleanliness of the hotel was good. Room size was in my mind, small. My sons air con was faulty, whilst this resulted in a reduction it shouldn't have happened. Staff were however, very good. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Security Issues & Annex Rooms”
Reviews.Author: xsenia
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Adriano in late July for three nights. This was our first visit to Rome and we used TripAdvisor in order to pick the hotel. We booked through Booking.com and noticed there were annex rooms that were described as being superior to those in the regular hotel. They described the rooms as having a shower, bathtub and balcony with a view. We paid 644 euros for the three nights and looked forward to staying in the room. Upon arrival, we were shown to our room by a man (he has a neck tattoo - didn't get his name) who we would have numerous encounters with over the three days. He led us to the annex, which is a building right beside the hotel. It has a separate entrance on the same street, just a few doors down. Never did he offer to help us carry our luggage. He took us in the hotel which had a front door, then a security gate, then led us up three flights of narrow stairs. There was another door, which was the entrance to the annex hotel, and then to our room. We were given a key chain with 6 keys on it, four of which were required, so there were 2 unecessary keys on the key ring. They were not labelled and made entering the four locked doors very tedious. Regardless, we entered the room and I was immediately disappointed. The room, while a good size, was very run down. The duvet was frayed and worn, and the tiles were mildewy. Immediately we noticed a mould smell. The balcony was small and had no real view, and was too small for more than one person to sit out on at any one time. There were no other people staying in the annex while we were there (that we heard or saw anyways), and it appeared there were 5-7 other rooms there. The annex did have a two person lift, the kind with the double doors. On our first night, we came home and took the lift up. We then went to bed around midnight. At 2:30 am, I awaken by the sound of the room phone ringing, which probably had rung a good 10-15 times before rousing me. I answered the phone and the man on the other end let me know that he was calling from the front desk and he needed me to go out to the lift and close the doors, because one of them had been left open and the lift would not work to move to other floors. To give context, the lift was located one flight of stairs down from the hotel, in the main stairway where there are also residences. The hallway was narrow and concrete, and had numerous other apartments that were not associated with the hotel. This would require me, at 2:30 in the morning, to leave the room, go outside of the locked hotel area, down a flight of stairs and to the lift. Immediately this struck me as weird and my instincts told me not to do it, as I felt I was being lured or something. I unplugged the phone and went back to bed, obviously very anxious at this point. In the morning we brought this up to the front desk, and they told us that they did not call, and that we should never go out in the hallway for that purpose, etc. They thought that maybe one of the residents had called us and pretended they were the front desk. Later that day, the phone rang again and there was only breathing on the line. I then called the front desk and told them again of the situation and the new phone call. The front desk said that a resident could not directly call us as it is a hotel phone, reached only by dialing the room number from inside the hotel. She said the front desk would not have called. So, we never figured out who kept calling us, if it was indeed the front desk, or if someone was messing with us. If it was the front desk, it was totally inappropriate, as the situation could have been remedied by a staff member in less than four minutes. If it was not the front desk, that was a very troubling occurrence. I have never felt so unsafe in my life and I had a hard time sleeping. I was very nervous entering and exiting the hotel at night. We were not offered a remedy and when I asked about changing rooms, I was told we could, but that we'd have to switch twice due to the hotel being at capacity. It should be evident that this was a troubling experience. The rest of the hotel seems safer but these "special" annex rooms need to be sorted out. Another strange thing happened during our stay. After a long day of sightseeing, we took a nap in our room before getting ready for dinner. While we were napping, I heard a faint knock, it sounded like it was someone knocking on a door down the hallway. Almost immediately after, the door opened and it was the man with the neck tattoo. In his hands he had the drinks he was going to replace in the mini-bar. Instead of saying anything, or leaving the drinks outside the room, or seeing us and leaving the at the door - he enters the room, walks by the bed we are laying in, opens the closet, and restocks the mini bar, like we weren't even there. I was so surprised I couldn't even say anything, and I would have gotten up but I was not adequately dressed. This was really strange and also unsettling, especially in light of the other events. I would possibly return to this hotel, but would stay in the main hotel. The annex rooms were unsafe, unclean and not worth the over 200 euros per night they cost. The man with the neck tattoo - who also was the bartender at one point - is odd and made me nervous. I wish we were asked about our stay but none of the staff inquired. Had these events not occurred, I would rate the hotel a 6.5/10. The state of the room and the mould smell were definite issues. That being said, the breakfast was good and it had an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended and we weren't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MTimbrell
Reviews.Content: A really lovely boutique hotel right in the heart of Rome. With two small children we could easily walk to Piazza Navona, the Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Spanish steps. An area full of restaurants and great for walking. We had a very nicely appointed and quiet family room on the third floor. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful in advising restaurants, tours etc. Breakfast was simple but well thought out and delicious. I would easily recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a short city break. One good tip I was given before traveling...don't rent a car in Rome! Nowhere to park, small narrow streets and very complicated. Once in Rome you don't need your own car, everything is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TINUS68
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to your lovely city and what a pleasant hotel to use as a base. From Hotel Adriano you can walk to all the interesting sights in Rome-no taxi needed. The staff members were very friendly and accommodating. We had two rooms and on arrival one room was not acceptable(bathroom not cleaned). Front desk immediately moved us to another room. Breakfasts were great with a varied fare. Our next visit to Rome will include the Hotel Adriano. Thankyou for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: brauenhorst
Reviews.Content: We loved the contemporary decor mixed with old world artifacts at this lovely property so close to Piazza Navona and Pantheon areas. Breakfast room was beautifully lit and comfortably large. The breakfast was great too! Only downside is that curtain door to bath does not afford enough privacy if you are traveling with an older child. Ask for a room that has the new decor. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: j_machin
Reviews.Content: Stopped here in June as part of our honeymoon and we loved the hotel. Its not a big hotel but is in a great location with lots of bars and restaurants on the door step and is in an excellent position for sight-seeing during the day with nothing more than a short walk away. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable - we had a room with a balcony and the bathroom was modern and well equipped. Best part was the bar man who was friendly and very helpful with recommendations for bars/places to eat

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ejochum33
Reviews.Content: we were pleasantly surprised!!! this is a 3 star hotel and we have stayed in 4 star hotels in italy that were not as good as the adriano! great location - many sites within walking distance (vatikan, angel's fortress, piazza del popolo, pantheon, spanish steps, fontana di trevi, piazza navona...) great service - helpful staff nice room - newly renovated...but the corners in the shower were not clean... :-(( great breakfast - opulent buffet and very nice restaurant great atmosphere!!! great value!!! we'll be back!!! i can definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend! Great location, clean hotel, nice staff - maybe bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: vailskiier22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a classic twin that had been recently updated - which was a nice surprise - I was expecting the old style orange (per web site images). The room and separate (door) bathroom were spotless, everything worked, nice opening windows, restful decor. It was very noisy though, being on the first floor above a narrow lane. During non- sleeping hours, I enjoyed the hustle and bustle. We expected city noise and bought ear plugs - so it proved to be no problem. I suspect if we had closed the windows and turned on the Aircon, it would have drowned out most of the noise. The communal areas are beautiful, intimate and quiet. Breakfast had a good range of choices. The breakfast staff and general hotel staff were delightful, very kind and accommodating. The reception staff were polite and efficient. We really could walk to everything, except maybe i would not attempt the forum in hot weather - but buses available very close. Thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: JHJ_123
Reviews.Content: We booked a "double deluxe" and asked for a modernized room with a balcony. We had the reservation confirmed twice and got the room we wanted (room 422). The room and facilities was modernized in a minimalistic manner. The room was small (like most european hotel rooms) but adequate for two persons with only little baggage. The bed was firm and the pillow a bit hard but, nonetheless, we had excellent sleep. "The bathroom" was separated from the sleeping area with only a curtain which was inadequate for securing "bathroom privacy". The toilet had a semi-transparant sliding door and the shower had a semi-transparant door. The balcony was large and equipped with a lounger and a chair. Flowers and plants made the balcony nice. Moderate street noice is to be expected in the middle of Rome but it felt like culture more than a problem. The view was uninspiring looking at antennas on neighbour builidings but the sky was clear and the balcony sunny. The hotel seeems to be mostly visited by couples above 30 years and it is quiet and relaxing. However, TV-noice from next door and voices from the corridor is quite evident when they occur (which they rearely did). Breakfast was average. The Hotel Adriano is perfectly located in the old part of Rome with small cobblestoned "via's" just outside the door. The hotel is in walking distance from all the major sights from the Vatican to the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Reliable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TEC10009
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed here twice, once in Oct 2009 and most recently in May 2011. This is a great hotel for the American traveler - comfortable, clean and familiar. Both times I stayed here was with groups of friends/family for weddings. The communal couches, nightly happy hour and comfortable lobby are great for meeting up with everyone, relaxing, zoning out, etc. The desk folks are somewhat helpful, if not a little grumpy. The location is fantastic - you can walk to many sites from the hotel and the fabulous restaurant Gusto isn just a short walk away. Rooms are expensive, but very clean. I stayed in a double regular which was fine with a great separate bathroom. The next time I stayed in a twin superior, which was gorgeous - except the shower stall was outside the bathroom, in the middle of the room. Not a big deal, but a little awkward for a double twin room. (If you're not sharing a bed with someone, you're probably not comfortable with them showering in the middle of the room!). Working around this wasn't a problem, though. Breakfast is reliable and good. Unfortunately, there's no wi-fi in the rooms; and you have to pay to use it in the lobby. I had a major problem with this - If i'm going to pay ten euro a day to use it, i want to do it from the privacy of my room. They do have a computer station for guests to use free of charge and most guest seems to respect time limits, etc. I personally would prefer a hotel that's a little more traditional; but I'd definitely stay here again -- especially if traveling with multiple generations (they have an elevator!).

Reviews.Title: “Recomanded- will stay again..”
Reviews.Author: DaniTheFox
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome early June 2011 for 2 nights after an amazing week in the southern parts of Italy. Hotel Adriano- Great location without a doubt! Closely located to all tourist attractions. 5 Min walk from the Spanish Steps and same for the Trevi Fountain, 5 Min walk from Piazza Navona and a few more to Trastevere while bus stops for the rest of the attractions are close by. Rooms are smallish but clean, modern and comfortable. The public areas of the hotel are absolutely beautiful and decorated very stylishly. Front desk service is quite average where we felt that help and assistance are available but you have to “squeeze the lemon” to get it which sometimes makes you feel uncomfortable. Breakfast is nice with the normal European buffet table. Price- a bit high in my personal opinion but I guess it’s same for any other place in the area. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant staff but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: l0ves_t0_plan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the more modern section of the hotel and the room was very nicely laid out. The location couldn't be more perfect and in Rome that counts for a lot. The food at breakfast was pretty average. This hotel was the only one we stayed at that charged for wireless internet, and the internet was only available in the lobby. There was one free computer for the whole hotel. The front desk staff was what made this hotel lose two stars. We dealt with at least three different people at the front desk and all seemed extremely uninterested in helping us. Each did as little as possible to answer our requests. We met a couple while waiting to use the computer and they were complaining about the front desk as well so we weren't alone in our feelings. Overall stay for the location not the service.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Punxsy954
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel five out of five stars. The breakfast included was sumptuous, seven to ten a.m. The main desk is very helpful in getting you to your destination, either with directions or providing a taxi. The street is one way and smaller than the major streets, so the traffic is not as heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful community areas, great breakfast, good location, small guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: madzyn
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous place to stay. The downstairs public areas are gorgeous...loved the decor. The breakfast was fabulous. My only complaint is that we thought we had reserved an updated room because we reserved a "deluxe" vs a "classic", but as it turns out, the only updated rooms are the "Superior" rooms. Our room was adequate, but small and loud with traffic noise from the street below and would occasionally get a sewer smell through the air conditioner which was not remedied. I would definitely stay here again and get a superior room. The staff was very helpful and friendly and attended to our every need. The location was great. Very central to all major sites...within walking distance of most. The clientele was upscale. I think it is a good value for the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: H4L96
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room was a lttile less then desired but the customer serive made up for it. Breakfast was good but Internet Access not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kabryan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 3 days we were in Rome. My husband and I were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go from our hotel! The hotel staff was very helpful with our questions: tours, places to eat, getting a taxi to the airport, etc. Each morning (free) breakfast (pastries, eggs, fruit, toast, cereal, yogurt) was held in the breakfast room - it was decent and provided a great start to the day. The rooms were decent, though small in size, and the shower was great with a rain shower option. We would definitely recommend this to friends and family travelling. You had to pay for internet, but there was a computer in the lobby for use that we never had trouble using. We booked well in advance (3+ months) and received a discounted rate, but were treated with the same courtesy as other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Retreat in a Busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: RHTubbs3
Reviews.Content: We ended a 9 day vacation with three days in Rome. After visiting Varenna and Vernazza and completely decompressing, we were worried the hustle and bustle of Rome would elevate our stress. But the Hotel Adriano provided a most relaxing environment. The room was spotless (stayed in classic room), the bed comfortable, the A/C most welcomed with Rome temps in the 90's, and most importantly, so quiet!! The staff was very professional, knew your name after check-in, provided perfect directions with maps and were helpful if asked. Good breakfast buffet although you should try all the wonderful establishments around the hotel. The location was fantastic. Easy walks to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi, etc. The hotel is located near Parliament, so you felt very secure with all the security around. Although, Rome in general felt very safe. My only complaint was the 5Euro daily charge per device for wireless, which adds up when you have 2 phones and a computer. They do offer free wired Internet on a computer in the lobby. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: scoutoby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Adriano for 3 nights at the end of a 10 day trip. After staying in the country in Tuscany we were so relieved to have found this updated modern hotel. Everything was very clean and the hotel staff was very friendly. The breakfast they serve was amazing, fresh fruit, hot eggs, breads, cereal, yogurt, you name it they had it and a very cute eating area! My husband arranged for flowers and wine to be delivered for my birthday, I could not believe how perfect the staff was in timing the delivery. We stayed in the corner suite and loved the view and location. There is a very nice Mozzarella bar across the street. And for those of you that are worried about crime in Rome, don't be, There are 2 police stations right outside the hotel (they are actually all around Rome). The location was perfect to walk to every attraction in Rome. I would not think of staying anywhere else if I return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Villadsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Adriano for four days, and it was wonderful. The hotel had arrangement for us from the airport and we can recoment it. As soon as we arrived and during the hole stay we felt very welcome by the friendly staff. We had a deluxe-room with a big terrace. The room was great, clean, big, very nice decorated and hade good beds. The location is perfect, only two minutes walk from Pantheon and close to all the other sites. We have been to many four and five stars hotel, so why Hotel Adriano have only three stars, I don't understand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: myexperience123
Reviews.Content: I really loved this Hotel and the location! I felt it was the perfect location so we could leave the hotel at night to walk around. It was very romantic! The tour buses were blocks away, and of course we did the whole tour. Service was great! Staff was very pleasant and helpful with maps and directions. Breakfast was included in our stay. We had to go downstairs to the lobby in order to use the WIFI internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: shilps2000
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Adriano. The hotel was well located in our opinion, not far from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. We walked everywhere even to the colosseum and the hotel was in a good location for that. The front desk staff was nice and helpful, I needed a flat iron for my hair as the one I brought broke and they helped me locate a nearby salon that sold them (huge for me!). They arranged for a taxi to the train station at the end of our stay. They also had a nice spread for breakfast. We were on the second floor, had a nice sized comfortable room. Yes the bathroom had a "curtain" for a door, and the bathtub only had a half-door, but as husband and wife this really wasn't a problem for us. The only thing missing for us was free wi-fi. Apparently though according to other reviews there was a room with a computer with free internet access (I don't remember this being mentioned to us at check-in and it wasn't a HUGE priority so we didnt seek it out). It just would have been nice to be able to use my smartphone in the room to look stuff up (for free). Even so, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: JohnSF_S8
Reviews.Content: Great location, can walk to most sites in the city . Relativeley quiet location. Rooms were small ( as in many hotels in Europe for that price) but were clean and comfortable. It is better value than other hotels I have stayed at in Rome for similar prices. I will always stay here in the future when visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronmiami
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel within walking distance of 90% of the major sites. We had a very comfortable stay at the Adriano. I would stay here again next time I visit Rome. We stayed here at the beinning and end of our trip. The rooms we had were modern and seemed pretty new. As some of the other reviews had mentioned some of the bathrooms do have glass doors but we asked to be in another room before we got there and didn't have a problem. If they are booked solid they may have trouble switching at the last minute so make sure you make that request before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “The best 3 star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: LenaFod
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice surprise. I usually don't expect much of a 3-star hotel but this was VERY GOOD! Cool interior, fresh and delicate, friendly and helpful stafff, nice room, quiet and perfect location. I thought it was a 4 star hotel. I will stay here next time I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find and Two Great Stays!”
Reviews.Author: hollingster
Reviews.Content: This is was my second stay at Hotel Adriano; the first one was in October 2009. I had a good experience then, and knew as soon as we planned our wedding in Italy, that we would be staying at Hotel Adriano for our first few days in Rome. The hotel is ideally located, close walking distance to sites. The classic rooms although typically small in size, are clean and bright and have very large bathrooms. Some of our guests stayed in the upgraded rooms, which were large, modern and spacious; only caveat there is that the bathrooms are a bit less than private, and could be a little uncomfortable for some people. What I really like about this hotel is the large lobby area. There was plenty of room for us to meet down there when planning our days/nights. There is also a separate room with a computer and free internet. We also had happy hour drinks at the bar; the little complimentary snacks were a nice touch. We found the staff very helpful in assisting us to coordinate with our guests, who were arriving on different dates and times. The breakfast is more than ample, and the breakfast room itself is large and comfortable. The age or our group ranged from 28 to 65 and we all enjoyed our stay. I don't think you can beat the amenities, the location and the price. While it is not cheap, neither is Rome as a whole!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: eliza531
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not our original first choice, but it turned out beautifully. I found the staff to be helpful and spoke great English. The room was much larger than most European rooms, very clean. The location of the hotel was excellent, we could walk everywhere we wanted to go, and it was tucked away in a quiet location. Many of the places we had looked at ended up being in very travelled and noisy locations, and this place is in a much better location. I wish the hotel had free wireless, and that it was avaiable in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: rbyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at this hotel -- which was pretty upscale compared to the family owned hotel we stayed at in Florence. Large, clean rooms but wifi was not free. Hotel staff was helpful and a couple of their restaurant recommendations were good. Location was great because we could virtually walk to all the sites. Location of the hotel was a bit off the beaten path but eventually we got our bearings. I would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adriano was a delight from working via email pre travel through the stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy33848
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service and beautiful rooms! Arrangemnets were made ofr us to and from the airport and we even stored 2 large bags for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, remodelled clean hotel in city center”
Reviews.Author: JorgePoss
Reviews.Content: Nice clean remodelled hotel in good location. Walking distance from most city monuments. A bit on the expensive side but otherwise we had a nice stay. Breakfast room small when hotel is full, suggest extend BF times

Reviews.Title: “Great service - Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: jestbe
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 4 nights and very much loved this hotel. The staff is courteous and friendly and you cannot get a better location. The deluxe room with a balcony is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: as444
Reviews.Content: What a find!!! We spent 4 nights in Rome on our honeymoon and were lucky enough to choose Hotel Adriano. We had a deluxe room with a huge balcony overlooking the charming Roman rooftops. Despite arriving very early in the morning we were able to check into our room immediately. The room was a great size for European standards and due to the recent renovations everything was brand new. Yes the bathroom door was frosted glass and semi see-through but that is the only negative thing I could say and I have high standards. The location was PERFECT only a few blocks from the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon with the Trevi only a couple more. The staff were incredibly friendly, particularly one gentleman who was very sympathetic one day when I was very unwell after traveling all the way from Australia. The complimentary breakfast was also great with everything you could possible want and more. My family and friends will all be choosing Hotel Adriano following our glowing recommendation as will we when we return. Hopefully in the not to distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Bobleponge216
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel because of its location, centrally placed and in the 5 days we stayed, we walked to all of the major tourist sites in this wonderful city. If you want location then this really is the hotel for you. For the remainder however I was disappointed. The bedrooms were small, our room was right next to the lift and so we were woken or disturbed on a fairly regular basis. No tea and coffee facilities in the room, no free wifi in the rooms and very expensive. The breakfast was reasonable, fairly limited range although all well prepared and presented. The staff were generally friendly although we didnt ask for much, as we didnt spend too much time inside. It was our first time in Rome, we fell in love with the city and will definitely return, although certainly not in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrific breakfast”
Reviews.Author: barbaram_2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located for the things we wanted to do in Rome. We used their airport pickup service and it worked very well. The room and bathroom easily accomodate 3 people. The only down side was the internet access which did not work at all for accessing our e-mails. Staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great loacation, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: BUSLADYUK
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were friendly, welcoming and helpful. We stayed in the 'junior suite' which has a king room on a mezzanine level and a double sofa bed downstairs. Both beds were comfy and we all had a fab nights sleep. The location is fantastic, close to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryCeol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adriano for one week with my 14 year old son. The hotel was wonderful. The room was clean and spacious, with a very large bathroom with tub and shower. The breakfasts were wonderful....with meats, cheese, rolls and eggs. The best part of all was the location which was central to all the glories of Rome. We walked everywhere from this central location. A small disapointment is that there is a charge for wi-fi in the hotel. I couldn't use my smart phone, which I had expected to be able to do. There is one computer in the lobby available for use free of charge. I have stayed elsewhere in Rome, but this is the hotel I will go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, fresh, clean with a touch of class!”
Reviews.Author: alive1
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome to attend the papal Easter mass. The Vatican website mentioned that they would assist hotels in obtaining free tickets to the mass. After numerous e mails the hotel let us down. The reception staff could really take tips from It's humble bartender and waiters when it come to hospitality. No coffee in the rooms or an iron available! The hotel is clean with a chic lobby area...no free wi-fi :-( things in hospitality that comforts a guest. No coffee in the bedroom or an iron to use was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value, A+ breakfast”
Reviews.Author: YVR_Hon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finally went on our long-overdue honeymoon. We went to Paris, Rome, Siena, and Florence. Needless to say, this required extensive research and planning. TripAdvisor was a vital resource for me, and the reviews have helped ensure a wonderful vacation of a lifetime. In Rome, we stayed at Hotel Adriano. The location of this hotel can't be beat, everything is within walking distance: Piazza Navona and the Pantheon, within 5-10 minutes; Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi, 10-12 minutes; Colosseo, 20-25 minutes. However, the hotel is on a quiet side street so as soon as you walk inside the hotel, it will feel like a retreat from the hubbub of Rome. We booked a newly-renovated superior room and it was just the right size for us. It had a good layout, rainfall shower (no bathtub which was totally fine), room safe, and a relaxing colour scheme of soft gray and white. Obviously, I cannot review any of the non-renovated rooms in the hotel but I would recommend the newly-renovated rooms in a heartbeat. The hotel offers a free breakfast and it was a really good spread - scrambled eggs with ham, boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, cheese, bread, lots of fruit, juice, coffee, etc. I would agree with the other reviewer that the selection does not vary, however, there was enough variety in what was being offered that you could change what you chose to eat from day to day (eggs today, cereal tomorrow). The breakfast room was spacious and charming. You have to ask for a cappuccino from one of the staff, they will make it for you. The only thing I would suggest to the hotel is to allow guests to control the airconditioning in the room a little bit more. We were lucky enough to have great weather during our entire trip in Europe and it was pretty warm in Rome. We could not change the thermostat setting to anything lower than 20-something (21?) degrees. Maybe we had a faulty one? I would consider this a minor issue, it would not stop me from staying at Hotel Adriano again. Some tips: 1. For an inexpensive lunch, there is a small pizza place really close to the hotel that serves amazing pizza (fresh ingredients, great crust). Not a fancy place, you eat on a bar stool and a long counter. Unfortunately, I did not get the name of the place but it is literally a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel (same side of the road as the hotel). Wish we discovered it sooner, we would have loved to try every single one... 2. Sightseeing: The Vatican is a must-do but the lines were sooo long. Save yourself time (and a migraine), book ahead. You can either book online directly with the Vatican or even better, book a tour (I recommend Presto). Same goes for the Colosseo. 3. Do your research on pricing - check travel websites, check the hotel website for special offers, even call the hotel directly. Most hotels offer an advanced booking discount, non-refundable but worth it in my opinion since most will offer between 10-15% discount on top of the best rate. Some will throw in breakfast for free if it is not already offered as part of the room rate. 4. Transportation: I was weary of all the warnings about being ripped off by taxis from the airport to the hotel so I booked with Rome Cabs to pick us up (they have glowing reviews here on TA and they were right). For a few euros more, you do not have to deal with the possibility of dealing with a greedy taxi driver. That's worth our peace of mind and a good introduction to a great city. Rome is a walking city but we did take a couple of taxis, one to the Vatican, another to the Colosseo. I think it makes a difference that the hotel called for us so we did not encounter any issues. None of the horror stories, thank goodness.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Within walking distance to all tourist attractions!”
Reviews.Author: nurseroc
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and could have not chosen a better place to stay. Hotel Adriano is located center of all tourist attractions and is within 15-30mins walking distance depending on the site. My husband and I stayed here for 5 days/4 nights during "Holy Week" (the week before Easter Sunday), the most busiest time of the year. I am gald we stayed here because initally we were looking into some hotels near the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain which ended up being loud and overly CROWDED with tourists. Hotel Adriano was secluded from the noise but close enough to walk to the tourist sites from the Colosseum and to the Vatican. A free breakfast buffet was available every morning, however the only one bad thing was that this hotel only served breakfast- no restaurant avail for lunch or dinner, which means you would have to eat out on the town. Overall, we truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welll located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Monteke
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with good service, modern, clean rooms with spare modern furniture that is well located near the Piazza Navona. The room was extremely quiet thatnks to very secure windows. It has a great breakfast that is included and the staff was always friendly and helpful. I wold absilutely stay here again and again when i vist Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Traveller42186220
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, Clean rooms, Central location we could not have asked for anything better. Although this hotel did not provide evening meals there was no shortage of places to eat nearby. The Piaza Navona was within easy walking distance and was a wonderful place to spend an evening with a wonderful ambiance

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Toitoi_11
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my sisters and stayed at hotel Adriano for 5 days. We booked our trip through Expedia and Adriano was one of the recommended hotels. From the minute we got to the hotel we were treated like princesses by both the Frond desk and the housekeeping staff. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, extremely clean and modern. The room was pretty spacious for a European hotel. The decor is just beautiful. The best feature of the hotel I must say is the location. Piazza Navona is literally three blocks away, Pantheon about two blocks and the best gelatto place Giolitti is only minutes away. We walked to Piazza Navona, Piazza d' Espagna, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Venetia, Piazza del Popolo (Colosseum)...everything is sooo convenient. For Vatican city though we had to take a 10 minute bus ride. Ask someone they will all help. Keep a map with you at all times though as the streets are pretty identic to each other so you might end up going in circles if you don't pay attention. Breakfast is complimentary: fresh warm croissants, different types of rolls, fresh daily fruit, yogurt, granola, oatmeal, cereal, swiss cheese, ham, eggs (scrambled and boiled), nutella, jam, fresh squeezed juice, cold and hot milk, tea and coffee. Absolutely amazing. Dining: I would recommend you go to as many Trattoria's as possible. That's where the locals eat. Da Tonino's Trattoria is just delicious, at Via del Governo Vechio by Piazza Navona...I wasnt a big fan of the restaurants at the actual Piazza Navona though. If you take the first right from the hotel, on your right you will find the best corner bakery. Fresh pizza, paninis, all kinds of cookies... It was an amazing experience. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is extremely well located, simple but with all amenities, and a friendly and accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: tobygoldberg
Reviews.Content: Rome is a walkable city, and this hotel, located in the Centro Storico, is especially convenient to just about everything. It's moderately priced, contemporary in decor, and well appointed. The breakfast buffet is included in the price and is ample. The staff at the desk, especially Eleonora and Carlo, went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BAD NIGHTS SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: DOKOMOKO
Reviews.Content: Stayed there only this month and was impressed by the décor. Unfortunately my room was facing the front of the hotel and right above a loose drain cover. Every vehicle that went over it caused it to make a loud bang and kept me awake all night. Fortunately the beds are very comfortable but the noise was very bad because of the drain cover. The double glazing does little to stop the noise. I changed rooms the next day and was put in the one next to it. If staying here ask for a courtyard room and not one on the road. The rooms were clean to look at but there was a pubic hair in the bed sheets. Not nice! There was no bath in my room but the shower was good with plenty of hot water and pressure. The sink did not drain well and would be half full after just washing hands. breakfast was in general quite good but on the last day, a Sunday, the juice had been watered down, this was a shame as the blood red orange juice had been nice during the week. I was also booked in for a business fee and went to pay on the Sunday to see they wanted to charge me 32EUROs more than had been agreed in the email. Luckily I had a print out of the email with me so got the price agreed. This mistake also happened to my colleague I was travelling with but who had left a few days earlier, both bookings were made at the same time. The hotel was kind and looked after my bag for me on the last day. Also it was misleading, I felt, but the hotel does NOT have free wi-fi it is 10 EURO/day to have internet in your room. Mixed bag of feelings towards this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: rsinner
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is extremely convenient, and we walked to all the major sights around (in any case you can do that in Rome). Even though it is so close to the sights, it is quite quiet. The only downside is that the road in front of the hotel is a main road (though it doesn't look the part) and you realise it when a car zooms by suddenly. We arrived by train, and it was a short ride to the hotel. The check in was pleasant enough, though not warm. However, the receptionist was extremely helpful with directions later during the stay. We stayed in the modern part of the hotel I presume. The rooms were quite modern and well done. My only grouse was that water from the shower would get into the room.
