Other than that this was the only hotel room (after 3 destinations in Europe) where the safe was large enough to keep the laptop inside. Very well thought out rooms, though there wasn't much of a view for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If I am ever going back to Rome, this is the hotel I want to stay at...and I did.”
Reviews.Author: LeilaKo
Reviews.Content: During my business trip in June 2010, i passed by Hotel Adriano and while standing outside i said to my friends "if i am ever going to return to Rome, this is where i want to stay" and to my surprise while booking at the last minute and unintentionally i booked it for our unplanned Christmas holidays. It was the prefect location, the perfect value for a four stars hotel, and the perfect spacious room. I should admit the bathroom has no door, only a curtain but well we managed. The staff service was what we needed for our two night stay but the location the location the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen_Indy
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, we walked EVERYWHERE. Our room was one of the newer contemporary rooms. The room was attractive and comfortable. We slept very well. The breakfast was included and delicious. The even made us cappucino at no additional charge. they have a small bar, which is great for nightcaps. Front desk spoke English, which was very helpful for us. They also had great suggestions for dinner. We loved everything they recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Mediterranean_addict
Reviews.Content: Warme recommendations for this moderately sized hotel. We stayed one week, splendid location within short walking distance from most of Rome's principal attractions. Friendly and competent staff, nice interior, good and substantial breakfast. A couple of negatives are due to noise from AC in the backyard and we would have liked two chairs at the small but adequate table. Payying internet only, cable in rooms and WIFI in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: Da-Rolling-Stone
Reviews.Content: Service was generally outstanding, with the glaring exception of one individual who had a condescending attitude-- he ruined the experience for my party.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Thanks Adriano!”
Reviews.Author: dkim76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Adriano for five nights in December. The room was modern with a great terrace/balcony. The breakfast was great with that strong coffee that you don't find in the US. The area is terrific - close to the shopping, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc. We would like to sincerely thank the hotel for their assistance and empathy. We flew to Rome through the snowstorm in Paris and our bags were subsequently lost by Air France. The hotel was generous to let us dial out without charge to track our baggage. Additionally, the very nice woman who helps run some of the hotel and restaurant gave us a very nice Hotel Adriano tote bag in order to pack up some of the new things we needed to pick up to continue on without our personal luggage. Great service. We can't wait to return one day to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel to visit Rome and stay with quality and good price.”
Reviews.Author: gusovar
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel is confortable, beautiful and cleanliness. I think the internet conection must be free in the room! It`s a good hotel for quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Audrey3388
Reviews.Content: Clean, good value for money, excellent central location and very helpful. If we return to Rome, this is where we're staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelmum
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed twice at Hotel Adriano and will stay again. It’s nicely situated just off the Via Della Scrofa in the middle of what would be a triangle formed by the Mausoleum of Augustus, the Piazza Novona and the Pantheon. Like the Grand Hotel Minerva in Florence, it’s something of a business hotel with a bit of design flair. The public rooms are very design conscious with lots of low, cushiony seating and art objects here and there. The two breakfast rooms are nicely furnished with those kind of chairs they dress in cream denim pinafores for banquets. The included breakfast itself is tasty and has a nice variety of selections. Rooms are spare and design oriented having been recently refurbished. Reviews say that the front desk is inadequately staffed and I would have to agree but if you can get over that, the place is a good deal in the middle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for our honeymoon and would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Elysialc
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Adriano. The location of this hotel is the best, we walked EVERYWHERE in Rome. We stayed in a Double Deluxe room and it was definitely worth the upgrade. Our bed was clean and cozy, the bathroom was completely updated and large. The entire room was huge! We were in Italy for two weeks with two huge suitcases that didn't fit in our Florence Hotel. We had plenty of room at Hotel Adriano. The room was quiet (although not quiet enough to sleep with the windows open, but I"m not sure if such a place exists in Rome). A full breakfast is available each day and is a good way to start the day. It's not going to be the best meal you have in Italy but it's enough to get you going until lunch. There are two negatives. One, the front desk staff is very unfriendly and not very willing to help. Two, there is wireless internet available but you must pay 10 euro a night to use it in your room. If you have a laptop you can pay 5 euro a night and use it in the lobby area. There is one computer for public use but it's slow and not ideal to use. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: stressfreegolfer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so convenient to all the marvelous sights of central Rome. We could walk everywhere from the Vatican to the Colosseum, and beyond. We enjoyed the evenings in the lobby with a glass of wine. The rooms were small but well equipped. Breakfast each day was excellent with a variety of items served buffet style. I would return here on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The perfekt placing if you want to live in the middel of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kubstrup
Reviews.Content: Even though we are sure that the hotel is placed in a hidden street (like in Harry Potter) it is the perfect place to live if you want to be able to take a evening stroll around Piazza Novona or see the Pantehon at night. The room was nice and clean and breakfast was good. The staff was helpful and the only thing bad to say, is that their internet connection was a bit unstable in your room. But all in all a very good stay at hotel Adriano.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PJSSomerset_England
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at the Adriano - we first stayed 5 years ago before the hotel was refurbished. It's a great location for seeing everything you need to see in this beautiful city. Rooms are clean and comfortable although we did find ours a little on the warm/stuffy side at night. Huge choice of fabulous places to eat really close by. Try La Campana - a really traditional restaurant serving top quality food and frequented by locals. The hotel can book for you as it does get busy.

Reviews.Title: “greatest boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: angnowacin
Reviews.Content: amazing location, great rooms and wonderful lobby. Love the art and layout of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beaten, but otherwise only average, no real service or life to the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: BiancoBlack
Reviews.Content: In the very heart of the Centro Storico the hotel's location is exceptional. The rooms are OK and things generally work but there is no real life in the hotel. Breakfast is OK but staff hard to find. Reception team never moves from behind the desk and while they will do things did you, you are never sure if is almost too much effort. A good central position and great if you know Rome, or are ready to get out and discover the best city on the planet. Nearby you find everything, the best coffee, pizza, pasta, wine and tourist must-do's .... So it depends what you want really. At the price and given location and the upgraded rooms etc, I would still likely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: wolfhomma
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel using mileage points for a three-night stay in November. It proved to be in a good location, i.e. a small side street very near Piazza Spagna (subway), Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon. There is a good bus connection at the hub at Piazza San Silvestre about a 5-minute walk from the hotel. The room was small, but since we were are out most of the day, it did not matter much to us. The room was clean and reasonably quiet, and the view from the window was at air conditioning units and walls. The breakfast buffet was excellent, offering fresh juices, eggs, cheese, ham, fruit, and many more choices. We were impressed by the taxi transfer to Fiumicino Airport, which the hotel arranged for us. It turned out to be a private driver (no official taxi), who got to the hotel ahead of time and took us to Fiumicino on what seemed to be the feastest and most direct route. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, even tough the reception seemed to be understaffed and a little overwhelmed the night we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: hsdhillon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, walking distance to majority of sights and shops, had to get a cab to the Vatican but was only 7 euros. We arrived and were given a pretty poor room which had a crack in the shower base and a handle on cupboard missing, wiring was taped together and pretty dusty with a stain on the bed cover. We complained and were given a better room, it was probably one of the older rooms as they are refurbing the building. The new room we got was very good and breakfast in the hotel was ok but we only had it once as we preferred to get in the fresh air and try the local places. Really a great city to visit and seemed very safe.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations”
Reviews.Author: pjoana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicer than in the pictures. We have satyed in the deluxe room with terrace and it was very pleasent. People at the front desk are very nice and the hotel is located in one of the bests places. 5 minutes walking from piazza navona and pantheon and 10 minutes to piazza di spagna. The only bad thing is the "luxury" car that picked us up at the airport, supposed to be a BMW or Mercedes or Audi but it was an Opel.

Reviews.Title: “Best new find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pfra
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Rome many times and stayed at different more expensive hotels. Took a chance on this new hotel for an 8 night vacation. We were nervous but now so very pleased we made the change. Hotels location was absolutely fantastic Staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful Breakfast was very good and again staff went out of their way to assist us. Room was very clean not huge but more than adequate Bathroom really big. There was some early morning local noise but after 8am and not offensive. When we mentioned it to staff they een wanted to change our room. FREE INTERNET was an added find. Can not rave enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, made for a fantastic holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KHW_46
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights whilst visiting Rome. What can I say, for us the Hotel was in a perfect location with all the major sights within walking distance. The staff were pleasant and friendly. We stayed in a room with a terrace which was great for relaxing with a glass of wine after a day walking around the wonderful sights of Rome. There was plenty of fresh food to choose from at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevster5664
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for all the main attractions in Rome and we walked everywhere. Despite being right in the centre of Rome it was not particularly noisy apart from the odd car horn in the early morning rush to work. The room was quite spacious (for 2 adults and a child of 7) for Rome with a larger than average bathroom (including a jacuzzi bath). The room was refreshed daily with new towels and toiletries. All requests we made to the hotel staff were dealt with quickly . The included breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Yes you timed it wrong you may have to wait for a table but no more than a few minutes. But is that not true of most hotels. When I next plan a trip to Rome I would cetainly stay here again as it gets top marks for location, service and friendliness. A charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would def stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlee05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Rome July 2010. After extensively researching hotels in the area we decided on the Hotel Adriano. First of all the hotel is in an excellent location! its within walking distance to Piazza Navona (our favorite piazza of all), a 10 minute walk to the Pantheon, 25 minute walk to the Vatican, and 15 minute walk to the Colloseum. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. Our room was small but I think all European hotels are. The room was very clean and well-kept. The bathroom was cute and up-to-date and actually pretty spacious. The hotel staff was fairly friendly and the concierge got us cabs swiftly and was there to offer advice on restaurants ,shopping, etc. The breakfast was good (ham, eggs, rolls, cheese, croissants, fruit, etc). We would usually wake up, eat a quick breakfast in their lovely breakfast room, and head out on our day of sightseeing. Overall this was a great hotel due to its location, breakfast, and clean comfortable rooms. I am planning on taking my parents with us to Rome on our next trip and will def stay at Hotel Adriano again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a shame about room service and rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: roxyone
Reviews.Content: We were exhausted having spent a day travelling and then walking for hours around Rome. We decided instead of going out that evening we would treat ourselives to room service. The porter arrived with our tray and we pointed out that there were some omissions. Instead of correcting the mistake there was a call from reception to our room to say that they would not be bringing the rest of the order to our room as they were convinced we had it. I pointed out to them that we had checked the order with the porter. They rudely suggested we bring down the tray to reception, which I refused to do. I was also told the manager was not available! Following a few more phone calls the rest of our order did arrive but no apology. I might also add that all those calls were interrupting the movie we had ordered and were paying 10 euro for. Not a very satisfactory evening in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Great rooms,Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amandawicklow
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriano is a gem of a hotel. I was really nervous booking as there is so many to hotels to choose from but this hotel had it all. Within walking distanct of all major attractions and a really good breakfast to stay your day off right. The rooms was lovely with a small terrace to relax on with a glass of wine at the end of a long day of sight seeing. Perfect

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: WilliamAuckland
Reviews.Content: Adriano is in a great central location and has interesting, quite funky decor in public areas. Room was good size for Europe - had a 'modern' one with terrace which was lovely, and a good size up to date bathroom. Breakfast was good and as well as the usual continental fare had scrambled egg and bacon. Reception staff were friendly and spoke good English and gave good local restaurant recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MikeinJaffrey
Reviews.Content: The Adriano is a wonderful small hotel in Rome. We spent four nights there recently and found the experience flawless. Our room was modern and spacious (do be careful in registering because some rooms are very small and really meant for a single person). It's located in a nice neighborhood that's not far from the major tourist sites but not full of tourists. The Pantheon is a short walk as our Trevi, Spanish Steps, etc. The staff were very helpful in calling cabs, making reservations, etc. Breakfast room is bit bustling and crowded first thing in the morning but everyone is very understanding. A strong recommendation and we will certainly stay there again if we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: AmirAndriesse
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed in Hotel Adriano for a long weekend in october and loved every minute of it. First of all, the location is great. Walking distance to Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori and a lot of a sights too. Our room (superior double) wasn't big, but large enough not to trip each other every time we moved. Ned was nice and hard, not like many other hotels, that think the ultimate bed is a soft one. Anyway, fantastic shower too. Tv was crap (no radio channels, just a couple tv channels), but you don't watch tv when the city outside your room is a open air museum. Sure, there was some noise from outside. Scooters on the street, the garbage man in the morning, but with the window shut (and for americans: airco on) most of the noise stays outside. Oh, the breakfast. Wow! Two more excellent things: the bar/restaurant across the street and the farmacy around the corner (to cure that extreme hangover you get when drinking too much prosecco on the first night, like we did). By the way: when in Rome... rent a scooter! It's a fantastic experience that will last you a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: afunnella
Reviews.Content: My Fiance booked this hotel in room based on location and trip advisor reviews and we were very happy with our experience here. We arrived at about 9am after a long long flight from San Francisco and were eager to get to our room and catch up on some sleep. I figured they'd hold our luggage and we'd have to wander Rome for a bit until check-in. But happily they were very accommodating and put us in a room for a few hours until ours was ready which was at noon. It's important to note that there is a new wing and an old wing in this hotel. You want to stay in the new wing. The old wing is very old and faces some construction on the building next door. The rooms in the new wing are very very nice and very spacious for European hotels. Modern amenities, great shower and firm beds. We stayed in a deluxe room with a terrace. It was on the top floor and while the views are not fantastic, the terrace is very large and sunny and has a nice lounger and a little table. Location is phenomenal, it's within a very short walk of the trevi fountain the Pantheon. The plaza at the Pantheon is great as well with lots of street entertainers and nice cafes. We were there in early September and the weather was nice. It was hot but not unbearable with some clouds to keep it from baking. We walked to the Colosseum as well as the Vatican from this location. The complimentary breakfast was also very good, although it ends at 10am. The front desk clerks were very helpful and spoke excellent English. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but personally I would prefer”
Reviews.Author: danielakorem
Reviews.Content: shower & toilet doors which are not transparent....Opaque doors, thoroughly closed, since I happen to think that some body functions are best performed behind closed doors. Since not all the rooms are alike (we were travelling with another couple) who were more than happy to get closed doors for the above, next time I'll make sure to get one of those.... Other than that, our friends and us enjoyed very much our stay, especially the location. Sadly, we stayed in Rome only for 2 days, but managed to get everywhere by foot. We also took advantage of the transfer service to/from the Rome airport, which was very confortable and on time. Thanks especially to Eleonora, Korem & Berlovitch families

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DawnJOhannesburg
Reviews.Content: This is more like a four star than three star hotel. The reception area, little lounges, etc are very tastefully decorated and cosy. The room (double de luxe ) - was spacious, modern, clean with a lovely bathroom and a little balcony overlooking the surrounding rooftops. The breakfast was great for a European hotel. The hotel is situated in a very convenient and central position. Highly recommend this hotel - would stay there next time in Rome without looking elsewhere for any other accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a decent price”
Reviews.Author: yotamL
Reviews.Content: we paid 120 euro (they said it's a special price) and got a really great room with a large bathroom, a good breakfast and kind people. really close to the city center (Piazza Navona). we advise you to book in advance 'cause the place was full (so were the other hotels nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: SM-Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just five minutes from Piazza Navona and main sites this is the best hotel I have stayed in in Rome. Clean room that was quiet every night, amazing considering its close proximity to the sites. Helpful staff, excellent breakfast, slightly expensive for a five night stay but I suppose you get what you pay for in capital city. Would happily stay again and recommend to couples and small groups of friends for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adriano - Punches well above it's price tag!”
Reviews.Author: rscott4563
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Expedia and to be honest we weren't expecting too much. It's down as a 3 star hotel but it was quite cheap (about £400 for 4 nights) for it's location (right in the middle of the Centrico Historico district and walking distance to every major attraction) we figured the 3 star rating might be a bit optimistic. Well upon arrival we were really shocked - by just how nice it was compared to what the equivalent money would have got us in London or any other major European city we've been to. The entrance area, lobby and communal areas were very tastfully decorated in a comfortable contemporary style. There were little nooks all over the place where you could sit and chill out it relative privacy, the bar and tv area were superb and it had free WiFi throughout the communal areas and a free internet PC with printer. The room we had was great, spacious, light, a bathroom fit for a 4 or 5 star hotel. We had a mini bar, tv and plenty of storage space. The room price includes a complimentary breakfast served from 7am to 10:30am and once again it exceeded all expectations with a great range of hot and cold food and drinks. They also provided lots of fruit and muffins/cakes which you can take out with you to keep you going whilst wandering around Rome. I've got no problem recommending this Hotel to anyone who is visiting Rome and wants a top class hotel in a great central location for a bargin price.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good - in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: tomelise
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were both extremely satisfied - and had very good value for our money. Superb location, nice staff, clean, and room fully lived up to our expectation (room 324). A little suggestion - which does not affect our general view - breakfast juice should be better - and hang new flags outside the hotel - they look all worn down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but for the price hotel needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Ramagar
Reviews.Content: Good service and excellent location. However, hotel needs a facelift. The lobby is nice but the decoration is worn out (dirty rugs, sofas, chairs, etc.) The elevator was dirty and the rug on the stairs was stained and worned out. The room had a good size but the decor (wall paper, comforter, bed) was also old and worn. The room was not entirely clean. However, the bathroom was big and seemed to be renovated recently. No free internet or wifi (downside when compared to other hotels within this range that provided for free in room or at the lobby). The included breakfast was good but the breakfast room was full everymorning and we had to wait for a table. For the price paid this hotel should be better. Guess you pay for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mjm7919
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome for a few days with a group of friends including two married couples and found the hotel to be perfect for our stay. The location of the hotel was great and within walking distance of everything. The hotel itself was very clean with modern rooms especially the shower which included a rain shower head. It is sometimes hard to find a great shower in Europe but Hotel Adriano had one of the best I've experienced. The staff on hand was also very friendly and helpful while providing some great recommendations in the area. I would definitely recommend this hotel if staying in Rome. It is a nice clean convenient hotel at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with this attractive and conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandyK76
Reviews.Content: 'We found the hotel's location to be ideal for our sightseeing purposes as it was only a few blocks from the Pantheon and close to all the main piazzas. We decided to book a "superior" double room and were very pleased to have done so. The room was very spacious and recently redecorated in a modern decor. Other friends in our group who had booked ordinary double rooms found them so-so, and one couple said that their room was very small. Another couple had booked a top-floor "superior" double room with a small terrace with a roof-top view, and enjoyed being able to sit outside. The breakfast room was very elegant and the buffet highly satisfactory with fresh fruit, cereals, meats and cheeses, scrambled and boiled eggs and a variety of bread and cakes. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Lisa011
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel which makes it really easy to explore all of Rome's main sites by foot. There are lots of good eating places nearby too. We stayed in the new part of the hotel and the rooms were good. The front office staff were really helpful too when we wanted to book stuff. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Buonísimo! would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWithCookie
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, nicely decorated, very clean and roomy (especially by European standards). The bathroom had a bathtub with shower and lots of space. The housekeeping staff was wonderful--friendly but quiet and efficient. I would note that there is a Lot of street traffic and that if your room is on the 1st floor (second floor for US travellers) you will feel like you are on a motorcycle speedway and will want to move. We asked for a higher up room and our request was accomodated. The breakfast each morning was superb. Not only was there the usual pastries, bread, cheese and meats, yogurt and granola but also hot scrambled eggs with meat/ham/bacon. Again, the service staff could not have been more accomodating. If the breakfast is not super, sometimes I would rather sleep and grab a bite later...we would not have even Considered missing this breakfast--it was that good. There was a nice bar with snacks in the lobby that we did not use but saw some people there and it looked really good--so, not sure if that counts for a 'restaurant' but there were also SO many fabulous restaurants, trattorias, cafes and wine bars withing a block or 2 that I don't think you could miss a meal here :^) We felt the location was Very good....walkable to Vatican, Piazza Navona, Piazza Popolo, Pantheon, Spanish Steps. Some might consider that some of those spots would be a bit far but if you are into "New York"-style walking you could definitely handle it. A tip: if you decide (like we did) to take a cab to the Colleseum or another farther out spot, it is helpful to go to the major road by the river to get a cab. Since the hotel is located in a cozy historic district with very narrow streets, the cabs seemed to have a problem getting into the area and the rates were higher. Always ask the cab driver "how much to go to ______?" and see what they say. If they indicate the meter price will be the rate that's a good sign. If they just start quoting rates (especially in the 15-20 Euro range) we would try another cab. From the Colleseum, we were 1st quoted "25" then "18" then the last guy said "where do you want to go?" and we gave the Ponte Cavour (near the hotel) as our destination and it ended up being a meter rate of 8 euros--a big difference. ¡gracias a Giovanni y Julio para un buen viaje en Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mkr68
Reviews.Content: Life is too short to be wasting time wondering where to stay while you´re in Rome! We just arrived home after 5 nights at the Hotel Adriano, and it was our second visit there. To us, the hotel is the perfect hotel if you are going to Rome on holiday. It is situated right in the old town centre, and within walking distance of the Colosseum, Forum Romanum, Pantheon, the Vatican city (St.Peter´s Basilika and the Vatican museum), the Castel Sant Angelo and all the other hundreds of sites to visit. Apart from a very near perfect location, the hotel itself is fantastic. The staff is friendly and helpful, it is also a very elegant hotel with a quiet atmosphere, and it´s clean! The breakfast buffet contains everything you could be asking for - all in all just the perfect place!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: heartitalia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nestled on a small via, away from noise and traffic yet within walking distance of Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, St. Peter's and the Pantheon. More importantly, the delicious gelato of Giolitti and San Crispino are a stones throw away, and an Obika Mozzarella Bar is right across the street and available for room service! The breakfast was delicious, and the staff very helpful. The free use of a computer to use was a great touch, and the in-room blow dryer was the best I've ever used in a hotel, which, to a girl, is a great thing since they are typically bad. The bathroom was HUGE! I would--and will--definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: OkComputer_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location in Rome. We were in close walking distance of all the sites while still being in a nice quiet neighbourhood close to lots of shops and restaurants. The breakfast was great and included in the price. The rooms were a little small and the shower was European style and wasn't fully glassed in so we soaked the floor every day. The room was clean, however, as was the bathroom and the rest of the hotel. The decor in the hotel was modern and nice. Overall this was a great hotel for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Deano
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth hotel on a tour of Euorpe and id did not dissapoint. The hotel is in an ideal location to all of the main attractions, within 10 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and 20 minutes walk to Colesium and Roman Forum areas. The hotel staf was Outstanding, highlighted by Elanora, she was so helpful and freiendly. She was very informative and helped me plan a couple side trips as well as point out some GREAT places to eat. It is a smaller quaint botique hotel, but with all of the ammenities that you would want. Breakfast was good with fresh pastires, eggs, and cereals. My room was slightly on the small side but just right for a single, the double rooms are much larger. If you want a nice, clean, updated hotel with a pleasant professional staff in a great location look no further. Magnifico!!

Reviews.Title: “A well situated and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mcyawell
Reviews.Content: Good location, good service, needs improvement on internet access in the rooms, although obviously it is not a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jptripper710
Reviews.Content: The location was good - close to Piazza Navona and Pantheon. Rooms were small but clean and bath was good size. The A/C worked well and the staff was friendly. My daughter thought the pillows were horrible but the bidet was great! The breakfast wasn't great - they need to add some salami & prosciutto! I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time in Rome and Hotel Adriano was just perfect for us..”
Reviews.Author: NoPlaceLikeRome
Reviews.Content: We were anxious about booking a hotel at the last minute but found it very easy to book this hotel through their own website. We stayed in a deluxe room which was very clean and comfortable...and the kingsize double bed was greatly appreciated. Buffet breakfast was great with lots of choices for both of us and Coeliac friendly for me which can be difficult at times. Carlo confirmed at the time of booking that their would be suitable food for me and that a pharmacy was located across the street if I need supplies of gluten free breads and things...it was great to know that the hotel staff knew what 'gluten free' would involve. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better - 20mins from the Vatican and 10mins from the Spanish Steps...this was very central for us on our first trip to Rome so we were within walking distance of most sites and places we wanted to visit. I would highly recommned this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Ken_from_California
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. It was in a great location. Prices were reasonable by central Rome standards. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. The only downside was that the bedspread and the carpet seemed dusty and dirty. Some fingernail clippings were left by a prior guest in the bathroom. The cup in the bathroom appeared to have been used upon our arrival. Not filthy, just not up to top quality cleanliness standards. That said, I would stay here again because I do not believe there is better value to be found in a hotel in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, fantastic service and rooms - I found my new home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Diane159
Reviews.Content: Everything is close to this hotel - sights & shopping! The rooms are modern but yet warm. The hotel bar is really nice with great "happy hour" specials. I loved the room service - exactly what I ordered was delivered - this rarely happens! I usually prefer to eat outside (not in the hotel restaurant) but the Adriano has a wonderful daily fresh "mozzarella di bufala" menu that is the best!!! I have already told friends and will definately return to the Adriano!!!

Reviews.Title: “If location is key, this is the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: haga888
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about location. The furthest of the main tourist sights is probably the Coliseum and that was maybe a 20 min walk, if that. We didn't have to use the transit system because everything was walkable. Rome is an outdoor sauna in July, so having a well located hotel was great. As for the hotel itself, I'd probably have rated it a three, if not for the location. Nothing bad about it, just nothing memorable. The bathroom had just been relatively recently renovated so it looked nice. But the shower design was poor so it tended to leak a lot. Breakfast buffet was average. Good enough to get you going for the day though. It's on a back street so it was pretty quiet except for the random scooters and cars zipping by. Look both ways before you put your foot out the front door to the street though, as the road is the sidewalk and cars/scooters will literally use every inch of the road. Quite interesting. There's a mozzarella bar in the piazza called obika that was great. Never had mozzarella like that before. Great place for happy hour for sure. Also, if you walk past the two guard booths, to the left there's a great gelato place called giollitti. Or keep going straight down the street and there's one of those 50 flavors gelato place called Della palm that was good too. Avoid the tourist trap restaurants. Best advice I got on restaurants was looking for menus that weren't translated.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Adriano”
Reviews.Author: Brando50
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Rome for business or pleasure Hotel Adriano is my preferred choice. After a major renovation the rooms are very stylish, trendy and very confortable. Stuff is so kind and attentionate to make you feel at home and charming owner Barbara is always there to give you the best tips and ideas to make your journey unforgettable. Central position is so convenient that makes Hotel Adriano close to everything you want to do in Rome from historical monuments visits, shopping and best restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel to experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: DimitrisGreece0
Reviews.Content: Rome is one of my favourite cities in Europe and Hotel Adriano played an important role in making my stay a very pleasant one. Its location is excellent, I could walk to all historical sites of Rome, and there are many good restaurants nearby. Staff is friendly with very good recommendations for places to go for shopping and eating. My room was modern and very clean. There were not many international channels on TV, but I did not go to Rome to see TV, so I didn't mind. The lobby is fantastic, with a very warm feeling. Also breakfast is very good. I highly recommend this hotel to someone who wants to experience how the local people live in the center of Rome, without paying a fortune. I will certainly go to Adriano hotel again next time I will be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pk333
Reviews.Content: The Adriano is centrally located...within walking distance to everything. The room was clean and spacious, and the bathroom was fabulous. The breakfast in the morning was delicious with many options. This hotel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: aimnorthtc
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was perfect for all aspects of touring the major sites of Rome. Even cab rides to some of the sites were short and easy. The room was in the re-modeled part of the hotel (our request) and was sleek, modern and clean, although small. Their idea of a triple room was to simply add a roll-away bed for my daughter. It was, however, a comfortable little bed! There was a large cushion (really large!) standing up in the corner, for which we never discovered the purpose? The bathroom was very modern, immaculately clean, with a glass door that did little as it was easy to see through. We did find that the room was a bit odd, however, as the shower is actually outside the bathroom, and IN the bedroom. Ours leaked easily around the door, creating a flood on the bedroom floor every time someone took a shower, which judging by the discoloration on the wood floor, had been a regular occurrance. The room also had an odd odor, something we could not identify. I would return, but would ask for a room with the shower IN the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but the staff at the reseption could smile a little bit”
Reviews.Author: hcon80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in ok conditions, everything seems clean and nice. The location is perfect if you like to shop, sightseeing or just enjoy beeing in Rome, would recommend the location absolutely. The staff is friendly but seems a little bored with what they do, the information we requested wasn't delivered with a smil, funny how that affects the whole experince off the hotel. The breakfast was not good! That's a thumb down. All put together we would recommend the hotel because of the location, but it's expensive, the staff is not very serviceminded and the breakfast is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great value, great location, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: TimRitchie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was just what were looking for in that it was in a fantastic location within walking distance of all the main attractions, it was clean, tidy, and fairly modern. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was good. Overall it was good value for money and when we return to Rome, we'll be staying at Hotel Adriano again. The only thing to be aware of is that it is a little tricky to find the hotel but you'll be fine if you take a taxi from the airport or if you have a good look at some maps beforehand. It is worth noting that a taxi from Fumincino to the city centre is €50. This works out better than taking the train from the Airport to Rome and then getting a taxi from the station.

Reviews.Title: “A very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2rk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after a cruise. Our family of 10 booked 3 rooms. 2 of the rooms were triples on the 4th floors. These rooms were great. Everything was renovated and hip.. The size of the room were big with very modern bathrooms. One of the rooms had an awesome balcony. The balcony had 2 lounge chairs and pretty flowers. We used it at night. The third room we booked was a double and they put us on the 1st floor. This room was quite old and dingy compared to the rooms on the 4th floor. I don't think the hotel renovated the rooms on the lower flowers. The room felt claustraphobic after a while. It did have high ceilings but was very small. The location of this hotel was awesome. It was walking distance to everything. Extremely convenient. The breakfast was great too. Mostly self serve with great coffee, pastries, fruit etc. I would highly recommend this hotel - great location and rooms (as long as it is not on the first floor...)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rowersdad
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Adriano for a two night stay prior to a cruise, and was very impressed with the property. The location cannot be beat in Rome, and made it very easy to hit all the local top attractions by walking. Our room was well appointed, updated and very clean. The bathrooms were very modern and again, exceptionally clean. The front desk staff were very professional and helpful. Breakfast was excellent, featuring 3 types of yougart, pastries, eggs, coffee, cereals, juices, etc. I would heartily recommend this property to anyone looking for great accomodations

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Booboo19
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in December and felt I may be taking a chance as the reviews were quite variable. My experience, though was excellent. The location is fantastic as all of the sites are within a comfortable walk. The room was comfortable and modern with a great shower, and the double glazed window was very effective at keeping out the noise. The public areas are attractive, and the bar great for lounging around with a drink and nibbles after a busy day sightseeing. There was a good variety of hot and cold food at breakfast. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem right in the middle of the Historic Centre”
Reviews.Author: Kara977
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Adriano with my husband for 3 nights. Hotel is very central and close to nearly all the major sights. Rooms very clean and modern, staff helpful and polite. Would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a special place to stay in Central Rome. Cannot wait to go back myself !

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: lewisk_p
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a recommendation. Room error made on check in, we had to move rooms 2 times Told no, I wasn't able to have any extra pillows. No internet at the Domus Hotel - lots of stairs Hotel bar unable to make drinks on the menu Location is excellent

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: romeValletta
Reviews.Content: We experienced a wonderful time at Hotel Adriano the room was just great and the location was just right the staff were excellent very helpful and cheerful , we will surely think of coming again to the same hotel. Giordano

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: doubleminty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Adriano for 3 nights in March, the hotel was clean and our Standard Double room was quite spacious. We stayed in the 'new' part of the hotel, so maybe the older parts of the hotel aren't quite so nice? The breakfast in the hotel was very basic - hardly worth getting up for! The breakfast staff didn't seem to know what they were doing (rushing around, failing to turn around tables) - not bad, just not great. Reception staff were very helpful. One thing that did annoy me was when we returned to the hotel early one night (10pm ish), we found the bar closed The location of the hotel is great, we walked everywhere; Pantheon, Vatican, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Worcester99
Reviews.Content: To start with consider the location- Central Rome isn't that big but when your hotel is right in the middle of it all: Vatican 15 minutes walk, Pantheon 5 minutes, Trevi Fountain 10 minutes, Colosseum 20 minutes. You soon realise that you have chosen the perfect location. The rooms are modern and finished to a high standard. We took a standard double that didn't have a balcony or view but was certainly clean and fit for purpose. (Word of warning - both toilet and shower had frosted window glass. If you are traveling with someone who isn't particularly close to you, then there will be few secrets after this trip especially if you like the light on!) But I'm not complaining. Breakfast was great - select your own breads, meat, cheese, cake, drinks etc. Your can even boil your own egg. Perfectly acceptable to get you going. Open until 10am too so no great rush. Service and welcome is excellent. The staff are very helpful. The communal areas of the hotel are modern and very tasteful. If I had to criticize any part of the trip it would be transport costs. Tip: from the airport, take the direct coach into Rome (€8 each and about 45 minutes) I found us on the map as were traveling and realised that the first stop at the Piazza Cavour is just across the river from the hotel and 5 minutes walk to the hotel (you'll need a map). This avoided going straight into the Rome Terminal which would have required a €15 taxi back to the hotel. However getting back to the airport wasn't cheap. A taxi (it was a merc and very comfortable) was a set €50. The alternative would have been the taxi to the terminal then train or bus to the airport which would be a faff and still cost €35. I think €50 is too much for 30 minutes mental driving even with the exchange rate considered but we got there safely. Finally; if you are traveling to Rome on business or pleasure and prefer to be central and safe. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Greate location”
Reviews.Author: TravelVikingNorway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the “best values for money” I have stayed at. My girlfriend and I stayed three nights at this hotel for a weekend in Rome. The best is the location. It was 3 min waking to Pantheon, 5 min to Spanish Steps, 5 min to Fontana Di Trevi, 20 min to Vatican and 25 min to Coloseum. The Staff of the hotel was very service minded and kindly. We had a standard double room that was very comfortable and the standard was better than expected for the location versa price. Breakfast was ok and the breakfast room was very nice. The only negative was that the first room we got was located close to ventilation fan outside the make some noise. But when we were requesting a room change was that no problem and the hotel offered to collect and move our luggage to the new room. We will absolutely recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!! Excellent, but ....”
Reviews.Author: MarcusTheo
Reviews.Content: ask for a room away from the streets. These rooms are very noisy. The staff was very nice and helpfull. We visit Hotel Adriano twice a year and we will continue to stay at this hotel. Just because the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: isdili
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Adriano for the weekend starting on 8th January 2010 and the Hotel was a pleasant surprise. I travelled with my husband and 26 year old son and it was our first time in Rome. I had initially booked a hotel near the Colosseum as I thought that would be central but then after re-reading the Rome contributions and the review for this hotel I decided to change, and in good time too. Unfortunately my husband was sick during our stay and spent the whole weekend in bed. The great location of the hotel made it possible for me and my son to see the sights and still come back once in a while to the hotel to check up on him. It is a very welcoming and cozy hotel and it felt really nice to come back to it and out of the rain (yes we weren't that lucky with the weather) and walk into the candle scented lobby at the end of the day! Perfect! Although I had read some not so good reviews on the breakfast of this hotel I could find no fault with it. There is a negative point though, the street outside (our room gave on to Via d'Ascation) was very noise in the morning around 7 with somebody wheeling a basket full of laundry out of the hotel onto the cobbled street. I would certainly recommend it for its good price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelly-mad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in domus adriani for 4 days which is part of hotel Adriano And we were so happy to choose this hotel 1st of all the hotel is in the middle of all tourist attractions 5 minutes to Spanish steps trevi fountain piazza navona and many more Lovely neighborhood with many restaurants coffee shops and all the major shopping streets around the area The hotel staff is great very friendly, generally Italians are very friendly and they will make sure u got the answer to what u ask even if they don’t speak English Breakfast is excellent and the staff cant make enough to satisfy u and make u feel nice tips If u can afford a little bit more u can spend a little extra to stay in the domus adriani the rooms are fantastic with a Jacuzzi and a hamam(Turkish bath) in the shower which we really enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: potchgooo
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location could not be better. We could walk to all the sights of Rome within 30 minutes, and we never needed to catch a taxi or a bus. To get to the hotel from the airport, take the Leonardo Express train ( 30 minute journey ) Metro line A to Spagna ( just three stops ). You arrive at The Spanish Steps which is a great start and the hotel is just 10 minutes walk from there. Perfect ! Our room was at the back of the hotel, and very quiet. Breakfats could have been a bit better, but overall we were very veryu happy with our stay....and Rome was magical. Just watch for food prices before being seated at a touristy restaurant !!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, spacious room in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: UWSTraveler23
Reviews.Content: Our room at this hotel was newly modern/updated. The staff was fine and the location was great for walking around Rome. The breakfast wasn't great, but that's my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Shame about the Staff”
Reviews.Author: RMCNorfolk
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice for a very central postion, no complaints except my newly purchased lingeria went missing. The manager very politley told me that "the staff had been there many years and that guests often said they had lost things when they hadn't". No signs of a complaints procedure or apology. It was such a shame so beware of walking underwear

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: selise1222
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adriano was fabulous! It's located two blocks away from Piazza Borghese (not to be confused with the Villa Borghese), right near the Spanish Steps, tucked into a quiet little side street. The hotel is rated as 3 stars but I would have guessed it was a 4 star hotel. The whole hotel has been recently remodeled in a clean, contemporary chic look. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and we were able to check in early. The rooms have been redone with hardwood floors, modern furniture and flat screen tvs. The bathroom was enormous and completely modernized with granite and new sink/toilet/fixtures, etc. The bedroom portion was still small (standard European style) but otherwise no negatives about this hotel. It's a complete gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: castorbtandsharon
Reviews.Content: Did I mention GREAT LOCATION? Given the number of bad reviews on this site, I was reluctant to book, but as the hotel was in the area I wanted, and less expensive than many others, I decided to chance it. I shared a number of emails with Carlo Zoppi, and he assured me that I would have a room that met my needs. I was not disappointed. I was in Room #311, and although spartan (wouild like to see some color on the walls), it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was quite large by European standards and actually had a bathtub. Julio took me to my room, and apparently, he was also the housekeeper for my room. On the three nights that he attended to my room, it was better than the others (extra attention to details), but still, overall, I was satisfied. The hotel probably needs a few more Julio's, but that might be hard to come by. Breakfast could be better, but the rolls were quite good. Coffee was awful, but I did not find it better elsewhere. I should also mention a very pleasant restaurant within 5-10 minutes walking of hotel. It is "BEFORE" at 18 Piazza Nicosia. Not for "Foodies", but adequate and well priced. I had the best bruschetta ever, and the maitre de was quite charming. I would definately stay at the Adriano again.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ali046
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last year got a great room so booked again this year. We were given a room on the 4th floor - I was slightly worried when we got off the lift and the carpet was filthy and stained and I was right to be worried. Our room was tiny with two very small single beds pushed together. We had booked a double room and my husband could hardly fit in one of the beds! Also the wallpaper was peeling the bathroom was incredibly small and sprinkler head for the shower didn 't work! It was just a constant stream of water like a tap. No hairdryer, no safe these we could live without but were advertised on website. We asked to be moved to a room with a double bed as booked and there was no problem with this. When we returned to the hotel after a day out we were given the keys to our new room. Initially we thought it was going to be great - far bigger with a double bed-still no hairdryer or safe but this was the least of our worries. The bathroom ............the toilet wasnt screwed to the floor and moved if you touched it, the sink wasn't fitted properly and the plug was permanently stuck in so couldnt be used, the showerhead did work but the water was hot then cold and the bath which the shower was over had four holes in it! Very disappointing especially as it's not cheap to stay. Definately never staying there again and would not recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - this hotel has a split personality...”
Reviews.Author: n00dled00dle
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome and walked into this hotel on the chance that they'd have a room available for 2 nights. They said they could accomodate us but would have to move us to a different room for the second night. The first night was wonderful. The room was lovely - very modern and great value for money. The reception and dining room are beautifully designed and feel modern and clean. We couldn't believe our luck! However, on the second day our bags were moved to the new room while we were sightseeing. When we returned, it was as if we'd walked into an alternate universe. This room was filthy with old furniture, damp peeling patches on the walls, worn-out smelly carpet and a mouldy bathroom. Apparently the management ran out of money when they refurbished the hotel and so half of it is gorgeous and modern whilst the rest looks like a squat. We were shown another room in the 'old' section of the hotel, but this was equally awful so we left. A great hotel if you can get an assurance that you'll be in the newly refurbished part. If not, avoid it like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not great otherwise”
Reviews.Author: LMjetsetters
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Adriano on three separate trips to Rome. Our first two trips were in 2006 and our reviews of the hotel were excellent. After our more recent stay in 2008, we will not be returning to this hotel should we find ourselves in Rome in the future. The hotel has a great location but the unfriendly staff and unclean rooms are not what one would expect for this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug037
Reviews.Content: Rome was the last stop on our tour of Italy, and after staying in 2 fantastic hotels in Venice and Florence we were disappointed when we arrived here. The lobby and bar area are lovely, but when we got to our room it was tiny!! Also, the walls are paper thin and we were disturbed everytime the guests upstairs had a shower and woken up by the people next door who were chatting at 5.30am! The location is excellent with major attractions just a few minutes away, but if you're looking for a peaceful retreat after a day of sightseeing you won't find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Patess
Reviews.Content: Funnily enough, I booked this hotel after reading through heaps of reviews and not finding any negative feedback (granted, this was 1 year ago and it has taken me a while to wrie this). The cabride was interesting, the initial impression being that this hotel was in a diificult (read: maze) location. The reception looked good and I even saw some businessmen around - hence, great first impression. Then the room.. well I have been to Europe 4 times and stayed in some crap rooms but my goodness for the price (not high, but not low), it was terrible. Yes it was small but one expects that in Rome. But we did not expect the broken toilet, the non-existent hot shower, the ineffective air con, the broken door on the wardrobe which fell on us and the incredibly rude staff (how dare I ask for another room or for working amenities!!). I understand there are 2 separate parts of this hotel - one for Italian businessmen which is apparently nice and more modern (see the photos they use to promote the place) then the other side comprising the majority which were like our room. Being peak season I made the slly mistake of prepaying in full on-line - never again. The one good thing was the tip to use the free walking tours that start at 9 at the Spanish Steps - great guys and alternative spin - do the Ancient Rome tour, not the Vatican one.

Reviews.Title: “arrogant unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shinAustralia
Reviews.Content: Got to hotel and initially thought we had picked a good hotel based on the lovely foyer and bar area. During our entire stay the staff were AROOGANT, UNFRIENDLY AND UNHELPFUL (except for the lovely porter) When we got to our room we were very disappointed. it was small and dark. It had one small window in an alcove that had security steel on it with no view. We felt very clostrophobic. The bathroom was in need of replacing. The shower head was not working properly and fell of at one point. The TV did not work, it had to be replaced by another. Location was central.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: pete1176
Reviews.Content: Rome was the first stop on our Honeymoon. We booked directly through the hotel website, and had no issues (or so we thought). When re- confirming the reservation, about a month before we were to arrive, I had asked to have a car pick us up at the airport to avoid fighting the mob scene. They said that it would be no problem, a driver would be waiting for us at the terminal with a sign. Well, we looked around for at least 20 minutes and never saw a sign with our name or the hotel on it. So, needless to say, we didn't have the best first impression of Rome. Upon arrival at the hotel, everything went smoothly. The room was very large, two stories, with a huge window. Even though we were overlooking the street, there was very little noise from outside. Everything in the room seemed to be fine until I tried to take a shower. There was no shower curtain, only a 2 foot by 3 foot pane of glass. The shower head was a disgrace...it didn't stay in place, and it sprayed in every direction except the one it was supposed to. This led to every shower being followed by sopping up the puddles all over the floor. Breakfasts were fairly minimal, mostly breads and juices and fruit cup. Overall, the common areas were perfectly fine. Everything seemed clean and orderly. Our biggest issue was with the front desk staff. Checking out we were basically ignored by the arrogant and rude people at the front desk. I had asked the day before about calling for a taxi to take us to the train station in the morning, and was told that they would call when we were checking out because it would only take a few minutes for the cab to arrive. So the morning of check out, I head up to the desk to pay and ask to have them call us a taxi. There was no real acknowledgement of my question, and there certainly was no answer, so I figured that they would call after the paperwork was done. After asking again once the bill was paid, I was told one was on its way and took a seat in the lobby with our bags. Another couple then arrived, also to check out, and was speaking Italian to the two people behind the desk. They checked out and walked out front to a taxi that was waiting for them. I waited another 5 or 10 minutes before getting up to ask again about the taxi. The man who checked us out, nodded in my direction and finally called the cab company. He then said a taxi would arrive in 4 minutes, so we went outside to wait. Overall, I would say the hotel itself was fine. The location was great, Piazza Navona is only minutes away, and most of the other sights are not much further. Out of the four different employees we saw at the front desk, only one was helpful, and the two during checkout were rude and unprofessional. It was enough to make me not want to recommend this hotel to anyone, because I'm sure there are hotels in the same area with similar amenities that have a more accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rome was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: skibill
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to Rome as to the other places we had booked in Italia. But, oh my, my daughter and I had a wonderful time! It is easy to get lost walking around but not matter.....take your map with you and any number of policeman or other people have no problem directing you. The hotel was in a fantastic location and we could walk to almost everywhere and took the bus to some other spots such as the Coliseum. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly and helped call taxis or locate the correct bus route. I strongly recommend the 1/2 day tour of the Vatican as there is so much to see and Sergio explained many details I would have missed. We also went to a lovely outdoor jazz concert in the park at Villa Celimontana, the best kept secret in Rome! We could listen along with a bottle of wine and even order some food. So much to see in this wonderful town and we did find some great deals on fashion!! We did get a taxi to/from the hotel for ease. The train is so doable even though a bit confusing at times but I recommend reservations in advance and in 1st class for a little more. What a great country and we loved every bit of our trip to Venice, Florence, Monterosso and then Rome. What a way to spend time with my 21 yr old daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: mjt1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with wife, hotel is located in a fantastic location.. walkable to all major attractions. Hotel was clean, rooms large and breakfast more than enough. it is 30euro fixed rate from ciampino to inner Rome, we went Terravision coach then taxi , thought we were saving money but worked out more and far less convenient. For a good value base in a fantastic central location well worth it ...when we return to Rome would go back to this hotel. Loved Rome and the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “We were humiliated”
Reviews.Author: ETravellerFinland
Reviews.Content: Nice reception area, horrible filthy rooms, arrogant service but in good location....... Our room was not ready when we arrived and the Lady (very arrogant clerk) in the front desk gave us a map with instructions to nearest sights like Pantheon, Trevi, Piazza Navona and Spanish Steps. The location of the hotel is great and the reception and lobby area are very nice, but the style and standard really does not apply to their rooms.... (We booked a twin room from SunHotels web service through a travel agents' web pages) When we came back from sight-seeing we received the room which was a SINGLE room with one bed with FILTHY bathroom and running toilet. The room was extremely small and not cleaned at all for ages... We were very disappointed and angry and requested for a new room. As you could expect it took 1/2 hour for the front desk lady to organize anything after she had said "..just a minute I talk to my colleague..". Ok, we were offered a Double room which was a bit larger for on night and they suggested that we would be getting another room after that and we accepted their proposition. The bathroom (no bath just a shower from the wall/ceiling) was again filthy and disgusting and our mood was also very bad. The third room was ok with twin bed, with much cleaner "bathroom" (still no bath, only shower) "You did not order any bath..." - explained the clerk, No we didn't because in the Web reservation you could only reserve a Twin/double standard room...! The third room had wooden floors and nicer furniture and it was a bit bigger than the first ones. Breakfast was ok, without any fresh vegetables or fruits .(like in scandinavian hotels for example...). I definately would never go to Hotel Adriano again and would not recommend it to anyone, since I am sure you can find much better hotels in Rome and more value for your money!!! The hotel episode ruined our first days in Rome and the attitude of the hotel personnel was also humiliating and very arrogant. We wondered why we were put to the single room at the first place - do they treat all guests who have booked the room through web like that? Did they try if we would have been so stupid, that we would have accepted the first room as it was...that remains unknown. [The standard price for the last room was 190€/night and we paid 535€/5 nights but I still think it was not worth of the money.]

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adriano”
Reviews.Author: erika_leigh
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Kane57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4nts in late July for a midweek break. Arrived on the bus from Ciampino and caught a cab to the hotel, ended up costing about 15 Euro, be careful that you do not take one of the cabs offered by the touts as they might charge you near on double. Checked in without issue, and were shown to a nice twin room on the top floor, the view was nothing to write home about but then again when you go to Rome it isn't to stay in the hotel so this wasn't an issue. Went out and explored straight away, found that the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain were 5-10 min walks away, and so resolved to go there the next day. Used the hotel to escape the mid afternoon sun, and enjoyed having an hour nap in the afternoon as well. The breakfasts were nothing special, just eggs and meat, croissants etc. The grapefruit juice and red OJ was disappointing, as were the tea facilities. Still, with so many amenities nearby this was not a great issue. The hotel was easy to find, and the staff were friendly. I felt totally safe and would stay there again. We booked through [--] and got a great rate for £200 for 4nts for the pair of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarthTraveler3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a double standard. Had a balcony to our surprise. Staff was great. Location outstanding. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Loved the blood-red OJ from sicily. Hotel felt safe. Newly renovated. Room and bathroom size pretty good. Larger than expected for Europe. Although shower was small but that's everywhere. Definitley would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: amber28
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome as the last leg of our three week Italian holiday. We caught a taxi from the train station (15euro, ask before getting in as the first taxi driver told us it would be 25!) and as we enterd the foyer, my husband and I were very excited. The reception area, breakfast room, bar and lounge area were decorated in a modern eclectic style (apparently only recently done) and we thought this would bode well for our room. The lady on reception was helpful and gave as a map and explained where the major Roman sites were, in relation to the hotel. The location was superb, close to the Panthenon and Piazza Navona. We walked everywhere easily and found some lovely restaurants and shops in the near vicinity. The room was small, (we were expecting that) and did have a little balcony with some dead plants in a planter box. The bathroom was disgusting with mould in and around the shower screen, so thick in places you could scrape it off. Also the shower recess was tiny, fortunately my husband and I are thin, even a slightly overweight person would struggle. The shower head was strange as well, coming out in a heavy single stream rahter than spraying. Difficult to wash the hair! I also had to ring for a hair dryer, there wasn't one in the room, but it was brought up straight away. There was also an ant problem in the bathroom with a stream of ants there everyday. I disconnected the mini bar fridge every night as it constantly hummed and would advise ear plugs if you want to sleep with the windows open. There is a modern air conditioning unit, but we didn't need to use it, prefering the fresh air. We thought the breakfast was ok there was actually tinned fruit and you could boil an egg. The toasters didn't really work and the juice was awful though. Also if you didn't get there in the first sitting, the tables were unlikely to be cleared and reset and you needed to find your own cutlery and crockery. This was our most expensive hotel and we just felt the room didn't live up to the price or the beautiful reception area.

Reviews.Title: “ideally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lukefr965
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Adriano everytime i stayed in Rome for now almost than 10 years, staying each time one week and i have loved it for its ideal central location in the center of Rome. I find the price reasonable considering the location (although hotels in Rome are definitely expensive). During the last two years, the hotel has been refurbished and is now a real three star hotel. For sure, i will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Iwalani
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is undoubtedly its central location, being just a few minutes' walk from Piazza della Rotonda and Piazza Navona. However, unlike some other reviewers, we also found it very comfortable. The public rooms are embellished with fascinating and eclectic decorative touches - ranging from porcelain artichokes to miniature dressmakers' dummies. Our bedroom was more functional than decorative but perfectly acceptable, with plenty of room, a comfortable bed and air-conditioning. The bathroom was a little cramped but , again, perfectly acceptable. We were lucky to have a room facing inwards, onto a small courtyard/lightwell - no view, but no traffic noise either, which is a huge bonus in central Rome! The only complaint we had was that the breakfast room was too small for the number of guests, resulting in queues, and the staff were not as proactive as they might have been in clearing tables and replenishing items which had run out (it was all self-service.) We would happily stay in this hotel again if we revisit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was dirty and view was horrible and that smell in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: BeaucoupTravel
Reviews.Content: I am experienced with Rome hotel room sizes, rates and noise. I booked a Double Superior room at Hotel Adriano for four nights (250 euros a night) after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and Venere and contacting the hotel directly to ask questions about type of beds in the rooms and Internet use for guests. I looked at and read everything on the hotel's website. I read nothing about the demolition/remodeling/construction that surrounds the hotel itself and the immediate blocks around it. I was also surprised at the lack of maintenance/cleaning in the hotel's public areas and in our room. The staff at the front desk were businesslike and polite. The room assigned to us was 206 on the third floor ( the size was okay for Rome standards and it had a large bathroom (both the bedroom and bathroom had windows which opened). ( I noticed there was a pool of water on the floor in the bathroom.) As soon as I walked into my room I was greeted with the workmen on the scaffolding a few feet from my window talking and staring at us. Even with the soundproof windows closed the noise was horrible. I went down to the front desk and told them the reason I wanted to move and they said there was only one other room (another Double Superior) available and it was an interior room looking into a courtyard. Room 211 was much smaller and the bathroom was also smaller with no window. It was quieter than the first room, however, the courtyard we looked out onto (see photos) was a demolition site of a building. It looked as if there was an attempt to demolish the building and then they just stopped. There were piles of junk, old commodes, sinks, tiles and bricks, etc. It was disgusting and depressing. I went back to the front desk and they assured me this was the only room available and that it was a Double Superior room. We opted to stay in this room with the curtains closed rather than the niceer room 206 with the noise and men looking at us. Our room' s nice wooden floors were filthy with dirt, hair and dust balls. Even though I left 4 euros for the housekeeper each morning (the first two mornings) I would return to find the same debris and dust balls exactly where they were when I left. The bathroom mirrors were never cleaned. The bathroom shower leaked so much water that we had to use the bathmat and two towels to soak up the water and keep it from flowing into the hallway every day. You would think they would get tired of the flooding and fix the problem, but , no. I noticed that all the sink stoppers were closed when we checked in. After raising them I figured out why. There was a disgusting sewer smell coming up through the sink, bidet and shower drains. It was hard to brush your teeth or spend any time in the bathroom. The stairs from the lobby to the rooms were filthy with dirt and dust balls also. The same dirt and debris was there for the four nights and five days of our stay. There is a small courtyard off the stairway and it was covered with cigarette butts, leaves and trash. It was not touched either for the days we were there. The sofas and pillows are worn and in need of repair or replacement. The rug in the bar/lounge was covered with black stains. At breakfast two ladies from the UK asked us if they could ask about our room and its condition. They told us their horrible experience and we realized it was not just happening to us. The Internet charge is 7euros for one hour, however, there is no mouse, rollerball or touchpad on the keyboard. Instead, you use a toggle button to move around the page and it is like something out of the Pacman era. We gave up and went to an Internet point. The men at the front desk were polite and professional. We ordered a car for the morning of our departure and it was there on time and the driver was professional. The condition of the Hotel Adriano is a shame because with some maintenance, improvement in housekeeping and time (when all the construction around the hotel is finished) it would be a great place to stay. The location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jitaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Adriano in late May 2006 during our honeymoon. The hotel was nice, breakfast was good, and the staff was very helpful. The best part is the location. It's within walking distance of all the major attractions ~ and we walked everywhere. It's very close to Piazza Navona which is very nice, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: bubb
Reviews.Content: As many have mentioned, this hotel has a great location just a few blocks from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. We walked all over and used taxis only twice (to get to the Vatican Museum and the Borghese) when time was an issue. We did walk back from both museums. Our room was on two levels, with a sleep sofa for our daughter and a sitting area, TV and the bathroom downstairs. We had a bed and a TV upstairs. Overall, the room was very spacious - the bathroom was just ok. The desk staff was helpful in calling taxis. The breakfast was fine but nothing special, though the two rooms where it is served are pleasant. We were there Easter morning and the staff put out candy and special breads, which was a nice touch. I would stay here again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, location FAB”
Reviews.Author: DarlingtonWatsons
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and the photo's of the rooms which look small but clean and the bathrooms look nice, however ours wasn't!!! We had the tiniest bathroom imagineable and the whole bathroom looked like it needed ripping out and replacing.(there was an old mouldy looking radiator in the shower!!!!) The room was tiny but you do expect that in rome.The bar area is lovely and inthe evenings they put loads of complimentary nibbles out which is a nice touch. The Breakfasts are very average but again ok to set you up for the day. The staff were efficient but not particularly friendly.
